Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live in this hotel forever!”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to Rome over a 30 year period, but the first time I stayed here. I visited for 14 days on this occasion and was more than satisfied with all aspects of my stay in this lovely hotel. Each morning my breakfast cappuccino was delicious, along with the many other tasty offerings. The staff at the front desk were absolutely fantastic with their assistance with everything I requested from helping to find a taxi rank on the morning of the Rome Marathon, the city had basically closed down, to booking a private transfer to the airport when I checked out. Jan even came outside to say goodbye when I left. I truly believe you would be hard pressed to find a better hotel for cleanliness, friendliness and location to get around Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location and the terrace”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location could not be better. The staff are also extremely nice and helpful, especially the man who worked at the bar on the terrace in the evenings. The terrace is absolutely amazing, perfect place to begin the day with breakfast and cappucino and even better place to enjoy drinks in the evening! I would definitely recommend. The room was ok, bathroom was ok but terrace and location make it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bazjosmith
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent value, lovely breakfast, polite, helpful staff. Roof terrace is a big plus, great for breakfast in the sun or drinks at night. You can walk to most places from the location. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dan W
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay for 7 nights on our visit to Rome in March. The front desk was always staffed with people willing to help with anything from directions to dinner recommendations. The location enabled us to walk everywhere. Our room was spacious by European standards and was cleaned and serviced well everyday. A glass of wine on the roof-top bar was a nice way to finish a day. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place to call home while walking to explore Rome. Be aware that the hotel is located in an area where there is some noise in the evening if the windows are open.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Albergo Cesari”
Reviews.Author: cabby68
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, people, location, breakfast. Front desk people were very helpful and very much interested in our concerns, etc. We would definitely go back. The only negative was the noise of the bikes at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ryan C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights earlier this month. The location really cannot be beaten. Minutes away from the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain, it is literally in the heart of Rome. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Rome. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was extremely comfortable. The breakfast was very delicious and offered many options. My only complaint was that the drinks in the bar were quite expensive. I believe I paid around €14 for a bourbon and seven, yikes! Would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Makes Rome seem small - in a good way”
Reviews.Author: W0lf68
Reviews.Content: Having only 3 days in Rome, and being a first time visit, it was paramount for us to stay somewhere that allowed us easy access to all the major attractions. Albergo Cesari fits the bill perfectly. The first day, in 2,5 hours, we saw Pantheon - which really is just around the corner - the Trevi fountain, the Spanish Stairs, Piazzo de Popolo and Peters Square at the Vatican. The next day we walked to Colosseum and Forum Romanum and the final day Trastevere. Apart from the fact that this is a very centrally located hotel it's also very good. Room was clean on arrival and cleaned every day, breakfast was much more than just coffee and a bun and the staff were happy to help with directions and recommendations. This is certainly a place I would choose to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: flyandspark
Reviews.Content: In a pedestrian side-street in the historic city centre, mid-way betweeen the Pantheon and the Trevi fountain, the Albergo Cesari is in just the right place for exploring Rome on foot and by bus. We strongly recommend this hotel. The room was quiet and comfortable, and the buffet breakfast offered plenty of delicious choice. The roof terrace is a big asset: breakfast in the sun, a relaxing siesta or an evening drink. No worries about language: the staff speak excellent English and are very helpful. In short, excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “nice small hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: silverstreak60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met another couple in Rome in September, 2011 and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. Loved the location cause you could walk to several of the main attractions. I would say the Pantheon was less than 5 minutes and Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona was only 10 minutes. Places to eat nearby made it a choice plus they had wonderful breakfasts served on the roof top. Our room was big and very comfortable. I know there are hundreds of hotels to choose and we just liked what we read about on it's site and we will stay again, and having thrown our coins in Trevi Fountain, I guess we will return. I will also add that the Spanish Steps is within walking distance. A main road is Via del Corso was 5 minutes away also.

Reviews.Title: “location and staff are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Timothy H
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Albergo Cesari in June with our blended family for a "Brady Bunch" honeymoon. We were very happy with our experience. Within 10 minutes, the staff were joking with our teenagers and showing them where to go on the map for shopping and gelato. The location is almost perfect- walks to Piazza Navona and the Trevi Fountain are 10 minutes or less. The highlights of the hotel included the very hospitable staff and the rooftop terrace for breakfast and drinks in the evening. The rooms were comfortable but a bit plain. My experience in Italy is that you have to pay a LOT of money to get fancy rooms. Overall, I would return in a heartbeat to Albergo Cesari.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Forgotmytoothbrush
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. The location is superb - on a lovely street between the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain. An added bonus is the excellent rooftop breakfast room/bar. We watched a thunderstorm over Rome one evening when we were there and it was simply magical. It is a little pricey but I think it's worth paying more for such a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Location Value”
Reviews.Author: davidandloretta
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Cesari for 4 days at the end of January 2012.This hotel is situated in a short pedestrian street just off the Via del Corso. Despite this it is wonderfully quiet at night. You can walk to the Pantheon in 5 minutes, the Piazza Navona in 10 minutes, and the Colosseum in 20. This is a superb location. The twin bedroom was in need of updating, but the beds were comfortable and everywhere was very clean. The breakfast is on the roof terrace - and it is a delightful start to the day. The staff were courteous and helpful. The room+breakfast was 120 euros per night - and that is a very good price for accommodation so centrally located. We recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “One out of the box...”
Reviews.Author: Jan M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albergo Cesari in January 2012 and had 2 rooms. The rooms were spotlessly clean if a bit dated - but if you consider it has been a hotel since 1787 this should be expected! The location was excellent and within walking distance of almost everything you go to Rome to see. The rooftop bar and breakfast facilities (and the breakfasts!) were a delight. The staff were the highlight however. All of them, breakfast staff, cleaning staff, and reception were terrific. Jan, Tomasso and Camillo especially deserve a mention for their care and attention, humour, and professionalism. Nothing was a problem for them - even arranging a quick trip to hospital for me in the middle of the night and phoning regularly to see how I was getting on - thank you Tomasso. We would highly recommend this great little hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: danielle d
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel with dated decor, that is clean and has an absolutely fabulous location. The staff is outstanding and incredibly helpful. Jan, Tomasso and Camillio deserve to be mentioned due to their outstanding service. There is a patio with heaters on the roof that our group utilized every night, even though it was December. The street that the hotel is located on is lovely and has many restaurants and some shopping. This hotel is within walking distance to all major attractions. Located on a cobblestone street in between the Pantheon and Trevi fountain. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: CarolynScout
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the hotel and were amazed how quiet it was, although on a bustling alleyway. Windows were double glazed. We enjoyed breakfast on the rooftop terrace. It was great being able to set off for our sight seeing straight into the squares and lanes surrounding the Pantheon or turn down the Via del Corso and head to the Forum... Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Small nice hotel that is close to almost everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days last week, and were satisfied with our stay. Bernardo and Tommaso were extremely professional and helpful, and they absolutely make the hotel outstanding! The first day we arrived the hotel at 9 in the morning, and Bernardo invited us to have the breakfast first while waiting the room to be cleaned. His warm and greeting gesture makes us feel like being home from day 1. The night shift at the reception is Tommaso, who has a great sense of humor and he always make us laugh when we ask him for opinions. Like all the other reviewers have mentioned, the hotel itself is a bit old, and the room is small, but it pretty much has everything that you need during the stay. Plus, the location is perfect and is convenient to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “not for non smokers”
Reviews.Author: Mardi S
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel we stayed in during our 5 week trip, and it was probably the worst. However, this is not to say it is a bad hotel - it isn't. It is very old, a little bit old-fashioned, and the rooms are on the small side, but they are perfectly clean. The beds are very hard, as previous reviewers have said, but they are still quite comfortable. The front desk staff are lovely, very helpful and friendly. The breakfast room staff are a little less so, possibly because they are run off their feet. The location of the hotel is brilliant. Our biggest problem with this hotel was the constant stench of cigarette smoke, even on the so-called non smoking floors, and in the non-smoking rooms. Italians smoke like chimneys, anyway, so you learn to live with it on the streets, but it's a bit much when second hand smoke comes through the airconditioning vents in your non-smoking hotel room while you sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ogramrebecca
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good-within walking distance of trevi fountain, spanish steps, shops, the coliseum, the Parthenon, etc. Our room and the lobby/halls were were a bit dark, dingy and out of date, but beds were clean and overall, the stay was adequate. Price was fair. There is a bar/restaurant on the top floor that is very good. Breakfast was excellent with a big variety- granola, yogurt, meat, cheese, bread, pastries, fruit, yogurt, etc. Although this hotel is nothing special, I would stay here again due to the good location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and helpful staff at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: mac6641
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based mostly on the location, price and reviews from this site and we were very pleased. Perfect location between the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. Easy walking distance to tourist spots, piazzas and cafes. The room was decently appointed, but not plush. Great room darkening shutters - was dismayed to find that we slept till noon our first day in Rome. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was very good with a great deal of variety in the European manner.

Reviews.Title: “2 separate stays / 2 different experiences”
Reviews.Author: DennyGOntario
Reviews.Content: We were in Italy from November 11-19, 20011. We had 2 separate stays at Albergo Cesari: the first 2 nights of our trip and the last 2 nights. Firstly, what was good about both stays, is the location and the staff, just as other reviews have said, so I won't go on too much about that. The staff are professionals, and they care. There was one thing in particular that really impressed us, which was the return of my wife's camera that she had left in the lobby when we left after our first stay. It was handed back to her when we checked in for our second stay. Very much appreciated. Now, the differences. If this review was based on our first stay experience, then I would be raving to you about the spotless room, the upscale furniture in the room, the fact that every mechanical thing in the room worked properly: all the latches, drain plugs, lights and switches, etc, etc. The cleanliness in particular was commendable, as my wife really notices the little things. If this review was based on our second stay, several days later, then it would be almost the opposite. The room was on a different floor, had crappy furniture that didn't work properly, showed much more wear, and my wife noticed the bits swept into the corners of the floors. Worst of all, the room reeked of Fabrize, but we soon came realize it wasn't just our room, but the entire hotel that had a musty smell to it (heating system perhaps?). I know the staff were dealing with it the best they could, and it was likely something out of their control. Still though... Would I stay there again? Yes, definitely I think. But based on our second stay experience I can't give the hotel any more than the 3 stars. But yes, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good staff, good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TH3R
Reviews.Content: LOCATION - fantastic location in Rome. very central, and can take the city tour bus just down the street from the hotel (about 5 min walk). close to a number of great restaurants (local, not tourist traps) and close to that famous fountain. STAFF - polite, helpful, and courteous. spoke English fairly well. ROOM - rooms were a bit small, but were quite clean. decor looked like it was from the 80's. bathroom was fine. they supply soap and shampoo, but nothing else really if I recall correctly. beds were a bit on the firm side. i can't remember if there was free Wifi, but there was a computer with internet access to use down in the lobby which was fairly convenient. BREAKFAST - there was a nice rooftop breakfast area, with a breakfast buffet. a nice, but small selection of breakfast foods, mainly cereals, pastries, and a handful of savoury items. excellent coffee though (like all of Italy it seems). i believe the breakfast was included in the package, and well worth waking up for, even though we only enjoyed it once or twice out of our 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: italygoing
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome in September. Initally I was disappointed with the lobby and no common rooms at this very small and hotel. Then after complaining about our small room (small for Europe) , the next night they found us a larger and nicer room which was very nice and comfortable. There was only a clerk at the desk and and he was helpful and gave us directions and suggestions. The breakfast was great! The roof top bar/lounge was fabulous. The location was the best! Close( 5-15 minute walk) to most all of the main sites. I would recommend this hotel but not a small room. I have no photo to share of this hotel except for the rooftop. No luxury but clean and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great valued hotel in awesome city”
Reviews.Author: emorel
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome (3 day stay after a 12 day Med.cruise) so we weren't sure what to expect.This hotel was recomended by our travel agent who we gave some parameters.A little surprised when we had to leave our key with the front desk on leaving but hey "when in Rome".We were quickly amazed how close everrything was , tons of sidewalk cafes and no problem with language.Rooftop breakfast was more than adequate. We would definitely return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable priced hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: samantha049
Reviews.Content: October 19, 20, and 21 we stayed in Hotel Albergo Cesari in Rome. The hotel is located immediately off the Via del Corso near the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps; it is about a 15 minute walk from the Colliseum. Our room was not large but comfortable. Our bathroom had a shower and was ample in size. The only drawback was that the air conditioning had been shut off probably because of it being October and this made the room awfully warm and stuffy. Sleeping with the windows open was not an option because of all the outside traffic and city noise. Our room was also located under the breakfast and bar area on the roof and when the dishwasher was running it made a lot of noise in our room. They let us change rooms but this one was in the same area opposite our first room, and we could still hear the dishwasher run. The breakfast was typical for Europe and it was fine with a good variety of foods. We loved sitting on the terrace at night and drink some wine. We had free wifi in the room. The staff of the hotel was very nice and helpful. Because of its location and the reasonable price we would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and 'wow' rooftop terrace bar but very pricey drinks”
Reviews.Author: BradandJanet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location and has some old italy charm about it. The coffee shop and bar across the lane from the front door of the hotel are fantastic and frequented by the locals which is always a great sign. We had a lovely spacious room with views to the piazza. The bed was ancient with a poorly sprung mattress but we slept OK. The bathroom is very basic but this is the old part of Rome. There is a great rooftop terrace which is groovy and modern with fabulous views and lovely table and lounge seating, but beware it is very pricey and the barman is an 'old hand'. So always enquire as the size of the alcohol serve and check the cost, indeed watch him pour the drinks. Also always check the wine list and price - the cheapest white bottle is 20 euro which is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - we will come back!”
Reviews.Author: OsloMarianne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at this lovely and very cosy hotel. Our children werw all left back home in Oslo and we really had the time to enjoy! We had the most wonderful room and it was all very clean. Very helpful staff and the most lovely roof terrace for brakfast and drinks at night. Very central and surprisingly good value for our money. We are both travelling a lot in business, and this was absolutely a very nice place to celebrate our 9. wedding day! The shower was, I must admit, very small, but who cares? (But I am happy we are not very big sized..) The only thing I think could have been better is the breakfast - the bread etc was rather dry and in Italy we expect fresh tomatoes etc. But if you like caces and sweets in the mornings I think you will enjoy your meal! However, the view and the atmosphere were so nice that we were happy anyway. We allready have recommanded the hotel to our friends..

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent location, great service, wonderful breakfast"”
Reviews.Author: Philip W
Reviews.Content: What wonderful surprise after a long flight, friendly staff, a clean and comfortable room, unpack and like excited children out into the afternoon sun. Within five minutes the Trevi fountain, and so close to a number of major attractions. The breakfast was wonderful the quality of the food was first class, a wonderful way to start the day gazing over the rooftops in the sun. The staff were always helpful and friendly, this is why we will come back and we hope sooner than later.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: eyedoc2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended our honeymoon in Rome. It may not have been the best order as we arrived slightly tired and very disoriented after a train ride and cab ride. One staff member was slightly overbearing as we arrived and tried to ask simple questions regarding location and possible restaurants. He was pushy to make reservations when we weren't ready and each time was pushy to make them close to the hotel in which we felt they were either friends of his or he got commission from them. We will say the one place did have pretty good food but was nothing special. We had recommendations from our own friends in which he quickly put them down and told us they were no good. We would appreciate those comments and suggestions had he not been overbearing about it and sent us 1 block away to his "friends" This was really our only "bad" experience with them and even then it was NOT a big deal. The location is absolutely perfect!! The hotel smelled terribly of smoke throughout but the rooms were clean and spacious. The breakfast is very nice and located on a very nice rooftop bar (that serves incredibly expensive drinks). Overall we would absolutely stay here again when in Rome and have recommended it to others!!! No place is perfect but for a large European city this is very good! :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location , great service”
Reviews.Author: 2blues
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Diana before our cruise this was so much better. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Breakfasts were excellent with lovely fresh fruit and a variety of meats and cheeses. The rooms very very clean . Great location ! Can walk to Trevi fountain and the other major attractions. Highly recommend this hotel. The double glazed windows kept the noise out.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Cesari, 2011”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful hotel, in a great location The rooftop terrace is fabulous, with great breakfast and evening drinks ( summer ) The desk is staffed by the most friendly and helpful concierges I have ever come across.

Reviews.Title: “great location but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: RVTripTip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights Sept 7, 8, 9. Great location - walking distance to historic sites and about 10 minute walk to metro station Barberini. Stayed in Room 38 which had a very comfortable double bed (I was on my own but even with two people the room would have been large enough). The bathroom was great - all the pulmbing worked and great size. One tip the hairdryer wasn't great (but I always travel with a small one) and you may want to bring your own soap or shower gel/shampoo for the shower. A soap was provided for the sink but a lot of places now give you those all in one body and hair shampoos which aren't always great for your sikn (but again I always travel with 60ml bottles of these things just in case). Nice roof top terrace. Breakfast was perfect to keep you going past lunch (hard boiled eggs, fruit, yougurt, cereals, juice, pasteries, cheese, cold cuts etc) Great variety to choose from. Staff was very helpful. My only complaint was the street noise. I happened to be in a corner room so the street sounds echoed of the close buildings (ear plugs helped). I could even hear the person snoring in the next room. (I'm a light sleeper). The AC worked just fine. Lots of space in room to but lugage and hang things up.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location,charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lizdavies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in Sept.2011. Perfect location to walk to all places of interest. Very clean, comfortable room. All the staff were lovely, nothing was too much trouble. would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoWallace
Reviews.Content: The Cesari is well located in the old part of Rome within walking distance of just about all major tourist attractions. It is a modern hotel in an 18th Century building. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are quiet with double glazed windows and the breakfast is excellent. Above all the staff go out of their way to be helpfull and provided well informed tips about what to see and where to eat. WE will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A very good three star hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sprunkle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cesari is situated in a very small and narrow but busy pedestrian street in the heart of the centre of Rome. You can easily walk all the highlights. From Coliseum till Vatican, everything at the most for half an hour walk. Pantheon is only two minutes and Trevi fountain within 5 minutes. The comfortable room was simply furnished with no unnecessary luxury. There’s a TV, wardrobe, desk with minibar (with the compliments of the staff), coffee and tea facilities, two chairs and a very good clean bed. What else do you need after a long day stroll in Rome? The bathroom is spacious with a very powerful shower and everything you need for your stay. Blankets, pillow slips and a sheet are changed daily. You can control the airco by yourself with the control panel on the wall. The room was kept very clean. If you have a room at the street side you can have inconvenience of the buzzing people late in the evening or from the trash men collecting the empty bottles from the restaurants in the early morning. Even when the windows and shutters are closed. In the morning they serve a very good continental breakfast at the wonderful roof garden from 07.00 till 10.30 a.m. There’s something for everyone. Fruit juice, coffee, choice of cheese and meats etc. The garden is also opened from 18.00 till 24.00 again as a rooftop bar. The hotel has no restaurant, but there are a lot of restaurants in the surrounding area. For instance directly opposite the entrance of the hotel. If you need more, behind the fountain at the left end of the square in front of the Pantheon you find a small Spar supermarket in the side street. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. This is really a very good three star hotel. There is really nothing to complain about. Otherwise book a more expensive hotel with more stars. When you arrive at the Roman airport there are a lot of companies who bring you to your hotel by minibus. You’ll find them in the arrival hall. You can also make reservation by internet in advance f.i. by Viator. A one way trip costs € 20,-- p.p. a taxi around € 55,-- till € 65,--. It’s also possible to travel by public transport but that’s less convenience due to huge crowd, limited Metro lines (just two) and don’t forget the pickpockets. If you decide to do so be aware of your belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: Joan C
Reviews.Content: The staff were all very helpful and engaging. The terrace/bar area was wonderful at night (very 80's style) Overall the hotel is a bit outdated - especially the bathroom. But the bed was comfortable and everything was clean. Location was excellent. If you like smaller boutique hotels, then this would be perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here”
Reviews.Author: SunSpangles
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Cesari for years and we always recommend it to others (and they have stayed also). It's in the most ideal location - right between the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. Yes, it's not the most modern hotel in the world; it's more old fashioned and 'Roma' style but it's absolutely fine. Clean, neat rooms with fabulous air conditioning. Don't be put off by any other reviews this hotel is IDEAL for Roma! (oh and the new rooftop terrace is amazing!)

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop Oasis”
Reviews.Author: franknewyork48
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Rome, I had trouble deciding where to stay because I didn't know how long it really took to walk to the sights. I booked a hotel at Piazza Barberini because of it's closeness to the Metro, and I booked Albergo Cesari because it looked more centrally located. I cancelled the one at Barberini, and I'm very, very glad to say I made the correct decision to stay at Albergo Cesari. The location of the hotel is SUPERB and is easily walkable to all of the sights.....3 minutes to the Pantheon, 10 minutes to Piazza Navona or the Trevi Fountain the other way, 15 minutes to Piazza Venezia or the Spanish Steps, just under 20 minutes to the Colosseum, and you can get to the Vatican in less than 30 minutes. I live in New York, so walking is the way to go, and that's true for Rome too. It turns out that my friend and I only used the Metro once to do the Appian Way and Catacombs, so staying by the Metro was unnecessary...and it's boring around Barberini at night. The rooftop terrace at Cesari is great for breakfast and wonderful later in the day for a drink or just to get out of the room and "hear" Rome. One evening, a woman sang arias in the campo beneath the hotel that added to the whole experience (she was good by the way). The hotel's concierges were very helpful in all that we threw at them, even the bartenders on the roof obliged us our many requests for ice. We want to give a special thanks to Bernardo for helping us get our boarding passes printed for our flight home. The room was typical and ordinary (we were happy to have access to the roof), but very clean and comfortable. Why would you want to spend your time in your room anyway...you're in Rome!! The windows were soundproofed and kept the morning bustle quiet. Air conditioning worked well. For first-time-to-Rome visitors, I would recommend this hotel. I would return too

Reviews.Title: “Would DEFINITELY Return”
Reviews.Author: mrselett
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, great staff. I stayed in a HUGE quad room with four twin beds. With four women traveling together, we were nervous that the space would be too small. In fact, it was huge and had two closets, two side tables, two huge chairs, a desk, a sitting chair and a tv stand in addition to the beds! There's also a small fridge with snacks inside, but room to store your own goodies. The bathroom was really nice, though we did have some occassional issues flushing the toilet. They sent someone up to fix it. The air conditioning worked flawlessly. Most times, we were too cold and had to adjust it! This was especially important in HOT August. The rooftop breakfast was absolutely stunning visually with great service. Unfortunately, we never made it back up for drinks in the evening. The friendly staff also helped us with directions, restaurant recommendations and reservations. They also tried to help us trouble shoot our calling card, which decided to stop working. There's a computer terminal in the lobby for free use by guests. The location can't be beat. It's a five minute walk to the Pantheon or the Trevi Fountain. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. You can walk to a lot of places, since you're in the heart of the historic center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: claire2767
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July as part of a 2 week stay in Italy with our young son. The location of this hotel is brilliant as it is right in the historical centre of Rome. We booked a superior triple room which was spacious (rather than a double room with an extra bed squeezed in) and clean although a little dark. This was however condusive to a good nights sleep. The bathroom could have done with updating but again it was clean and large enough. The breakfast area is lovely and the food was good with a lot of choice. The service at this hotel was very good. The roof top area was a real bonus, we sat up there in the sun at the end of the day. It was also nice to sit up there with a drink on an evening. Overall we would recommend this hotel, it was good value for money and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Central Location”
Reviews.Author: texas_Tmitch
Reviews.Content: A friend and I traveled throughout Italy in Oct. 2009 and this was our home base for the Rome portion of the trip. It was clean, well maintained and had a very good breakfast on the roof top every morning. If you get a chance, go up to the rooftop a pre-dinner glass of wine - it is very nice set up. The location really cannot be beat as it is in the middle of everything - smack between the Pantheon and Trevi fountain and much more reasonably priced than others with as good of locations. It made it very easy to walk to all of the best sightseeing, restaurants, etc. and never felt unsafe - the only time we jumped on a bus was for our day at the Vatican. Given it's location directly on main pedestrian street with restaurants, shops, etc. there was a good amount of noise into the night and early morning, but may help if you have a room off the back of the hotel as ours faced off the front. Regardless, I would easily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The rooftop terrace makes this hotel a winner!”
Reviews.Author: TonsMom
Reviews.Content: My 15-year-old son and I just spent two wonderful nights at the Cesari after an 11-day cruise. We both enjoyed the proximity to Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona as well as the hotel's central location to almost everything Rome has to see. We particularly enjoyed breakfast on the hotel rooftop each morning overlooking the surrounding neighborhood and the food choices were great. The last night we ate at an outdoor restaurant right around the corner from the hotel. The restaurant sits in the plaza next to the church you can see from the hotel rooftop. We were offered lots of little appetizers on the house and the food was very good. As an aside beware of restaurants in Rome that use frozen food and/or charge for bread.

Reviews.Title: “Location, nice rooms and excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Oscar_from_Denmark
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights at the Albergo Cesari. There are many good things to mention about this tourist hotel like: Location Good rooms Very good breakfast Very helpful staff (I really tested them with all the problems I had in Rome!) Free wi fi. The central location, rather close to the famous Trevi Fountain was great for me but remember that it could mean some noise comming from the busy streets. If in doubt remember to carry earplugs :-) I liked this hotel very much and is one that I can recommend without doubt. A taxi from the train station to the hotel costs 12 Euros and a taxi to the airport has a fixed rate of 40 Euros. Good luck! Oscar from Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money! Better hotels nearby for half the price.”
Reviews.Author: Lilit_LA
Reviews.Content: To conclude our beauitful trip in Italy, I decided to book us at Albergo Cesari for our last night based on the reviews I read here. What a disappointment! There are other hotels with a great location for half the price. Nothing special here. Too many turns and stairs that lead us to our very sad room. Inside in our room I felt like I was in a cheap motel. Of course, we were not going to spend all day in the room anyway, but a little comfort or simple upgrade to the room would have changed my mind. However, I must admit that hotel must have been full. Always people at the front desk, always a line to return the room keys and don't even want to mention waiting for 15 minutes at the entrance with a tried and unhappy baby while we tried to check in because the ONLY person working there was on the phone. Overall, will never pay $235 a night for a lodging here. I am a little soar about the $$ I paid here.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel, great staff, amazing location...definitely would return!”
Reviews.Author: JoJoJVanders
Reviews.Content: I was at Albergo Cesari for 3 nights. It was an amazing stay due to the location, very friendly, responsible, professional staff...and the impressive roof top restaurant. The rooms were small of course but clean, comfortable and safe. It was easy to find because it's in the heart of where everything is at in Novona. You want to walk to the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain, done! Each one block away. The breakfast is completely worth it. The only exceptions to this great stay was fickle internet, no air and hard beds (which I can handle). I liked that it was a quiet hotel as well. They're doing something right there! Chrs, JoJo

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough”
Reviews.Author: JimGPortland_Oregon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in June for three nights before a cruise and agree with the previous reviews. The location is second to none though recommend going for a walk to get pictures at Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon before 8 AM to get photos without a billion people around. Each major attraction was well within walking distance. The terrace is a wonderful spot to visit at night for a drink at sunset. The staff were extremely polite and helpful in every way. The rooms were clean and decently sized by European standards. We were extremely pleased with our selection of this property.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop terrace was the tops!”
Reviews.Author: jsfisch
Reviews.Content: Top marks for the excellent location (close to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, etc),very clean rooms, extremely helpful front desk staff (restaurant suggestions were all great) and the rooftop terrace was a lovely spot to eat breakfast and to enjoy a late afternoon cocktail. We would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, great Accomdation.”
Reviews.Author: ava9802
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was superb. It was our first trip to Rome and the location can't be beat. It is steps from the Trevi Fountain and other major attractions. The only time we took a cab was when we went to Vatican City - otherwise, get lost in the streets and enjoy this wonderful city. The Hotel was extremely clean and very roomy - despite the fact that Europe is know for tiny accommodations we found our room to be large and bathroom equally roomy. The rooftop bar is a perfect way to relax after a day of sightseeing. Thanks for a wonderful Stay!

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: AnnaEWhite
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with this hotel. It needs updating. The carpet is disgusting, the food is mediocre, and the rooms are just ok. Also, the staff was not as hospitable as another hotel we stayed at in Rome. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “A really great hotel in an ideal locality”
Reviews.Author: jacqWindhoek
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the staff at the Caesari ! After checking out we had to wait for 8 hours for our children to arrive in Rome before heading to Florence. The staff were very accommodating - they allowed us to stow our luggage and, in the heat of the day, relax in the rooftop lounge at no extra cost. in addition to its perfect location,our room was clean, spacious and very comfortable; the breakfast sublime. If we are lucky enough to return to Rome we will definitely use this hotel again. Jacquie and Peter Tarr, Namibia.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again, the Cesari is Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: JMSArchbald
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Albergo Cesari in Rome, this time bringing our son and his 18 yr old daughter celebrating her high school graduation. Our rooms on the 2nd floor were spacious with comfortable beds, powerful bathroom shower and great breakfast on the roof top patio. Same day laundry saved our wardrobes as we took with us very little in small carry-on bags. We walked everywhere and this time we actually found a restaurant which is affiliated with the hotel within a 2 minute walk. The Taverna Antonino fed us lunch and dinner well on 2 different days. We stayed for a week. Our thanks to Jan, Bernardo and Tomasso for their hospitality at reception and their ready answers to our many questions and of course Luigi at the Taverna for his great service and wonderful smile :) We will definitely be staying here again and highly recommend the hotel to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “As they all say...a great spot”
Reviews.Author: Australianjen
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Cesari at the begining of June. When we first arrived there was a problem with our booking, not sure whos fault it was, the hotel or our travel agent but we were only booked in for 3 nights instead of 4. We arrived too early to check in and we were asked if we could come back in a couple of hours. By the time we got back they had sorted out the problem with the booking and all was well. Our room was OK , no view from the window as it was in the middle of the hotel. The shower in the bathroom was tiny. I am a large person but not overly so and I had problems turning around. Any one over 100kg would not fit in it. Other than that I could not fault the hotel.......postion - great..........roof top breakfast - beautifull way to start your busy day..............staff - excellant, especially our breakfast host ..Mass, who served us each day with a smile and tryed to teach us Italian. All in all a great base for a stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Content: Albergo Cesari was the perfect hotel for our first trip to Rome! We stayed for 7 nights. The location is superb - central to all major sights. The service is outstanding - professional, helpful & friendly! Our double superior, corner room (#43) was large & comfortable. The roof top terrace is a lovely spot for breakfast (but watch out for persistent pigeons!) and for an evening drink! We were always glad to return to the Cesari after a long, hot day of seeing the beautiful sights of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sarasdad27
Reviews.Content: My wife & daughter stayed here for 4 days, and myself for 2 days. The rooms were great and the staff treated us well. Albergo Cesari is located in between The Pantheon and Trevi Fountain, no more than a few blocks from each. We never rode mass transit as we walked to The Vatican & The Colesseum. You'd be hard-pressed to find a better place to stay while in Rome, especially based on what some other places are charging per night. The rooftop deck, for breakfast & night-time, is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: EzzieLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in early April. The hotel is ideal for a short stay in the centre or Rome. It's a beautiful old building, clean, staff are friendly and helpful, and there's a pleasant roof terrace. Negatives would be it's a bit small and dark and our bathroom was tiny - but really that's city centre hotels for you and also, obviously, it's due in parts to the original architecture. The gentleman on reception, Tommaso, gave us a great restaurant recommendation - just a street away - which had lovely regional dishes - sorry I can't remember the name of the restaurant but he will tell you. As most people have said before, the best thing really about the hotel is the location. You can walk for about 10 minutes around the surrounding streets and already have seen a handful of the sights Rome is famous for, 10 minutes further and you're at The Colosseum. The metro system is great for getting around as well, cheap and easy to use. All in all, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Dreamer987
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Albergo Cesari for 3 days and it was fantastic. Beautiful old style hotel. Rooms are spacious and clean and the customer service is so nice and friendly, this seems to be the norm in Italy! Location is fantastic, 2 minute walk to Trevi Fountain and 5 minute walk to the Pantheon. Cafes, restaurants, souvenir shops all at your doorstep. Great atmosphere in the evenings. Just perfect. I'll be coming back here and can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. That's it”
Reviews.Author: joel304
Reviews.Content: 1. The hotel transportation never picked us up at the airport. We confirmed via email twice, and it was a no show. We attempted calling the hotel, and their phones were out of service (which lasted for 2 days for the entire hotel, and the entire trip for 1 of our 2 "superior" rooms) so, after looking for the driver for an hour, we cabbed it. 2. Arrived at the hotel where there was no apology for the hotel arranged transportation fiasco. We were told how busy they were, etc. 3. We waited 4 hours on the roof to check in. You would think they might clean our rooms first in that we were the only guests waiting to check in? Not true. We were told one hour ... 4 times. Eventually check in at 2:30, which is 1.5 hours after check in. 4. Rooms: dark, small, no working phone, no clock in either room, step up to bathroom with a ridiculously small shower "stall." NO CLOCK, no wake up call due to no working phone. 5. Internet out for our entire stay, and yes, nobody (except the guests) cared. 6. The hotel arranged transportation took us to the airport. Lovely looking ride, however, it was not working and could only travel 20 MILES PER HOUR the entire ride to the airport. Van stalled twice. Very pleasant being beeped at and given the finger for 1.5 HOURS to the airport. Discount offered .... NO. The only good thing about this hotel is the location. I have traveled throughout Europe, and this is one of the worst choices I have made for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “this is the place to stay in Rome, in the centre...”
Reviews.Author: tuf2please
Reviews.Content: we loved albergo cesari because of its location and the friendly staff. in particular, Tomasso was very sweet, always ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: clcoop28
Reviews.Content: Abergo Cesari could nt be in a better location in Rome. Rome is not small but from this location you could walk to most tourist sites. The rooms are standard with very little bells and whistles but they are very clean and the customer service here was great. The roof top bar was also a nice touch and they also had the best hotel breakfast we had while in Italy. Trust me, you need a good location in Rome and this hotel fills that need.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: crazyjaney9
Reviews.Content: Hotel is between( my favorite) Pantheon and Trevi Fountain, just off Via Del Corso. It is on a narrow street so it may be hard to find but we found it. Rooms were small and dark but I beleive the hotel is closing for a month Sept? for renovations which they need. The location was great however and the roof top breakfast was very nice. I am glad I chose this place but if I was to return to Rome I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “i would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lasunshinegirl
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in the heart of rome. it is in close walking distance to a few of the major sites, and is in about a 20 min walk to many of the other sites. you will definitely feel like you are nestled among the rome lifestyle. the hotel is among the cafes and shops both good for eating, gelato, shopping, and tourist site seeing. you are also very close to bus stops and taxis. the hotel staff are all very accommodating. I personally recommend asking for thomasso; he was very welcoming. the rooms are standard, nothing special, but very clean. i also will say that i found the breakfast to be very good. one small note: no iron if you need one for your clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, we loved it too!”
Reviews.Author: FSD21
Reviews.Content: The perfect location - literally right in the centre of the tourist map so walking was easy and bus stops were just around the corner on the Via del Corso. The triple room was spacious, with a 6-foot double bed and proper single bed for our 11-year old. Bathroom was compact but well equipped - decent shower over the bath and lots of toiletries including a small shaving kit. Staff were unfailingly cheerful and helpful. We booked our Vatican tickets online then Reception printed the voucher for us - well worth an extra 4 euros each to skip the queue. Plenty of lovely restaurants around and about, again all with friendly service - the notable exception being Rosa Rosae just outside the hotel - I wouldn't recommend it. Take an ID document (e.g drivers licence) to the Forum/Colisseum to ensure children get in free. Pay for just one audio guide and share it - you can replay any part in any order easily.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Ubula
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in March, both staying in Superior Single Rooms. The rooms were very clean and well equipped - small sofa, TV, tea/coffee facilities, writing desk, large wardrobe, room safe, comfortable bed - and the bathrooms were large, with shower (not bath), bidet, loo (obviously) and a good selection of toiletries. The windows were double glazed and had additional internal shutters so that the street noise was cut down considerably. (They can get very noisy, those Romans, especially if there's a football match on.) I'm quite a light sleeper and have endured some dreadful nights in noisy hotels but I had no problem sleeping in this one. The breakfasts were extensive - choice of bread/rolls/crispbreads, cereals, juices, yoghurts, fresh fruits, hams, cheeses, breakfast pastries and cakes. We certainly didn't go hungry! The breakfast room was up on the 5th floor, with a great terrace outside overlooking the rooftops and the church of St Ignatius. All the staff were very pleasant and helpful. Finally, of course, there is the location. On the road between the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon, it is as central as you can get. Lots of good restaurants and ice-cream shops nearby. Most evenings we would go down to the Trevi fountain, about 5 minutes stroll away, and have a gelato.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: McWerner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for three nights before going on a cruise. By far the best feature of this hotel is its central location to everything you may want to do to Rome. The Pantheon, the Vatican, Trevi Fountain are all only a few minutes walking distance as well as many other main attractions. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast included hardboiled eggs, deli meats, cheeses and a few bakery items. The only downside to the hotel was the worn feeling to the room. The room was clean but seemed like it could use a little fixing up. The hotel is difficult to find on your own, so it is worth having a taxi driver take you there. Overall I loved my stay and would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location, excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Bookpusher
Reviews.Content: Stayed post cruise for two nights. Loved the location between the Trevi and Pantheon. We walked to all major sites. Room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was large, the shower was small, but good. Mini-fridge and coffee making facilities in the room was very convenient. Nice to have a cup of decaf coffee right there in the room before retiring. The breakfast buffet was plentiful, fresh, and delicious. It is served on the top floor of the hotel adjacent to their lovely outside rooftop terrace. . Weather permitting, you can eat out on the terrace and enjoy the beautiful view. (actually you have a decent view from the inside breakfast area) The staff spoke excellent English and were very polite and helpful. We hope to return to Rome one day and will definitely stay at the Cesari!

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: summerbell40
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed out short stay in Rome at this charming hotel. It was so well located that we walked to all the main city sights, as well as to shops, restaurants and ice cream parlors. Breakfast was always hot, tasty and ready in the beautiful rooftop conservatory (too cold for the actual terrace in december). The cakes at breakfast were unbelieveably delicious!! The rooftop area becomes the bar in the evening which would be lovelier still in warmer weather. We enjoyed out complimentary welcome drinks up there - can recommend the Cesari Red cocktail. The staff on the front desk speak perfect English and are always very happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: FallingLeavesFarm
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on recommendations here and on the Fodors forum. Likes: You cannot ask for a better location to visit the city. VERY convenient to all the sites. Room was a decent size, a fair value and clean. SOME of the staff was quite helpul. Despite being on a somewhat busy street, our room was quiet at night due to the double panes. Breakfast buffet was absolutely fantastic! Rooftop bar was very nice. Dislikes: Wi-fi connection cost 5 euros a day which I didnt mind paying, but it was so slow it was almost impossible to use. Computer in Lobby suffers the same fate! Bed was WAY too hard. I could have slept on the floor and possibly been more comfortable. "Some" of the staff acted impatient with our "stupid questions." I would recommend to someone looking for an inexpensive hotel that is conveniently located-- but do not expect overwhelming luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: penguin248
Reviews.Content: Great location. In between Pantheon and Trevi Fountain (each just 2 or 3 blocks away). Staff at front desk, breakfast room, and bar were all delighful and very helpful. Room was a little dirty (nothing major), but could be overloooked for the convenience of the location. Small showers, but hey, it is Europe! If you want an "american" hotel, stay in the US! Bed was hard. Our room was in the front of the hotel, which gave awesome views of the street below, but also had the sounds from the people eatting and drinking at the sidewalk cafes on the street below, if we tried to sleep with our windows open. The room did have noise reduction windows, so we could shut out the noise, however, it was warm, and the air conditioning had been shut off for the winter. Try this restaurant: Taverna Antonina (ask the hotel front desk for directions, it is just around the corner).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Windrider40
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have been better. Walking distance to all of the sites. Great Neighbourhood. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise jewel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: deejerry
Reviews.Content: Recently, my husband and I stayed at Albergo Cesari. As I made this reservation by the comments on this website, I was somewhat concerned. To our delight, the hotel exceeded our expectations. First of all, it is not the Ritz! If that is what you are seeking, this is not the hotel for you. For the price we paid and the service we received, we could not have done better. The rooms and bathrooms, although small, were very clean. The interior of the hotel is relatively quiet. Due to the hotels location on a busy side street, the rooms at the front end of the hotel are noisier than those in the back. The shutters did help block out this noise. The morning after our arrival, the room was so dark and quiet that we overslept....and, I am a light sleeper. The hotels location is perfect. Snce we are in good health, we walked all over the city. Even if you are not fond of walking any distances, most of the sites are within short walking distance and taxis are readily available. The hotel is more than willing to order one for you. They arrive quickly. With the high price of hotels in Rome, breakfast included is a great draw. A continental buffet breakfast was served every morning on the hotel's rooftop. It was more than ample and delicious. It included many different varieties of pastries, cereals, fruits, juices, meats and cheeses. Soft boiled eggs were also included. The cofffee was fabulous and the milk is served hot. We were cruising after our visit to Italy so, we did not want to handle so many bags while traveling to Tuscany. The hotel kept our extra unlocked bags in their locked facility. We heard so many stories about theft in Rome. Obviously, we were a little uneasy leaving them. Upon returning to the hotel, our bags were delivered to our room and all was exactly intact and as they had been left. The owner of this hotel should be particularly proud of its' staff. Those at the front desk were so helpful with everything from restaurant recommendations to directions. Wish,my Italian was half as good as their English. The porter and breakfast server were so kind to us. We cannot say enough great things about this hotel. We will definitely stay here on any future visits to Rome. Please do not change!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place.”
Reviews.Author: TewantinSeadog
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at the Albergo Cesari, From arrival and finding a bottle of wine and fruit basket until we left and formally thanked by the Manager for staying everthing was great. Not your typical modern tourist hotel, older style, all in good condition, great character, rooftop bar and breakfast area, shuttered windows overlooking laneway, late night orchestral music from adjacent church, nothing is far away and the staff were most obliging. Great breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: nig5590
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel,staff very friendly and helpful,perfect position for all tourist spots,everything from the rooms to the rooftop bar and restraunt as good as could be expected.Breakfast superb

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: GwainB
Reviews.Content: If you are spending time in Rome, don't look anywhere else. All the reviews are right, this could not be a better location, right on a pedestrian street way but still convenient to local transportation. Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona are just moments away. There were so many great restaurants right in the area that it was hard to choose. We walked all throughout the old city, taking in all the flavor and sites Rome has to offer. The front desk was extremely gracious and helpful with any questions we had, and the rooftop deck was a great place to start the day with a delicious breakfast. Booking on their website was easy and efficient - staying here was a real pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position for sightseeing, couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: farfalla14
Reviews.Content: I first discovered this hotel about five years ago and have returned each year since. They have made a great improvement by making a rooftop terrace where it is truly delightful to have breakfast or enjoy a pre-dinner drink. this hotel is very close to the Pantheon (3 min walk) or in the opposite direction 3 mins from the Trevi Fountain. It is just off the main shopping street Via del Corso. Although it is right in the heart of Rome I have never been disturbed by noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great roof terrace.”
Reviews.Author: ElaineS01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at albergo cesari for 4 nights. I was very impressed with the location, couldn't be better. Only a few minutes walk to Trevi fountain and Pantheon, maybe 15 minutes to Piazza navonna. The room, number 39, was quite small, as expected. The bathroom was quite modern and clean, if very small. In rome though, you don't expect to spend much time in the hotel room as there's so much to do so it was perfectly acceptable for us during our stay. The minute you step outside the front door, there's a world of restaurants and shops to choose from. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace on the 5th floor and it is a fabulous spot to start the day from. Gorgeous cappucinos every morning in the sunshine, lovely.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoetfromBirmingham
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Cesari last week and found it a charming and beautifully located hotel. The location is perfect as always mentioned on this site so close to the major sites and a good selection of restaurants. The terrace is a real plus, great for evening drinks and breakfast in the morning which we found the perfect way to begin the day. The food on offer was excellent and varied and the service always friendly and happy to offer support and guiance. Rome is a fantastic city and staying central is a great bonus. The square Piazza di Pietra which the hotel is just off is charming and has a fabulous bar called Salotto 42, which is a great place to chill with drinks and apperitivos. We would easily stay here again when in Rome in the future. Thanks to all of the staff for our excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect - great location, fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: DF38
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few nights with a friend and if I go back to Rome I will certainly stay here again! The hotel is on the smaller side but in a perfect location close by to the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. The roof terrace is a lovely setting for breakfast, which has a limited selection compared to American buffets but everything we had was delicious (pastries and breads were great!). The service was phenomenal and Jan at the front desk was incredibly helpful with anything we needed. Our room was very clean, and while they don't have free wifi there is a computer in the lobby with internet access that you can use for free for any quick things you need to check on. I will certainly recommend this hotel to anyone I know traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location-Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Diane44
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on trip advisor, lucky to get a room for a week on short notice due to the volcanic ash at the time changing my plans from Scotland to Italy. The front desk staff were very helpful with providing advice, giving directions, etc, very greatful for their help as I had been left with no time for planning. The hotel is perfectly set in the center, easy walking distance to major attractions, great restaurants, etc. They have a great rooftop terrace, perfect for winding down after a long day of sightseeing. This is where they also serve breakfast, but after one week it would have been nice to have had a little more variety. Room was clean with a mini fridge, TV, safe, more spacious than I expected overall with the exception of the very tiny shower! There was one PC in the lobby, free for hotel guests, internet connection available in room for a small charge. Bottom line, LOCATION is PERFECT for seeing the sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: DaniRMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 2 minutes walking distance to Foutain Trevi and The Pantheon. It's a great location. The hotel itself is very old but has been renovated. Rooms are spacious and the terrace is excellent for drinks in the afternoon with a lovely view of Rome. The staff are very helpful and willing to assist in ensuring you have a great trip in rome

Reviews.Title: “Best location, delightful rooftop restaurant, and outstsanding Concierge.”
Reviews.Author: Artlover9
Reviews.Content: My grandson (9) and I stayed here for 6 days on a trip which included Paris and London. We arrived jet-lagged and early, but were warmly welcomed by helpful front desk staff.. We loved the outdoor rooftop breakfast and easy walks through ancient streets, to the Fontana de Trevi and countless other Art History lover's delights. My budding photographer grandson took hundreds of pictures, then left his camera in the taxi to the airport! We called the hotel, with little hope. The Concierge, however, contacted the taxi driver, got the camera, and mailed it to us at our next destination. Amazing!!! Sure the rooms and elevators are small by American standards, but the genial atmosphere made the stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: vfielding
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell: --PERFECT location. Walkable to all the major sites in Rome. On a pedestrians only side street with plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby. --Extremely friendly and helpful front desk staff. More than your average front desk service. They provide advice, call taxis, suggest restaurants, and all speak perfect English. --We had a room with a double bed and it was very ample (HUGE by European standards) with a completely modern bathroom. --If we go back to Rome, we will absolutely stay here again. We won't even consider another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gwhizrd
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and our room was pleasant. The shower could use a bit of a good cleaning, but that was our only complaint. The location can't be beat. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: lilsisbet
Reviews.Content: As a single female traveller (just turned 50), I was hesitant about being in Rome on my own. I had left my travelling companions (15 ladies) in Florence to make their way back to Canada. I couldn't travel to Italy and not see Rome. So I made my way on the train into Rome. The Albergo Cesari was recommended by my Travel Agent and she was right. I felt safe, the room was huge, clean and the staff welcoming. There are many places close by for a quick pizza or gelato and everything is within walking distance. I walked to/from the Collesum, walked back from the Vatican and of course the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona etc. Did I get lost - Oh Yes.... many times but it was fun exploring the city. Wear comfortable shoes though. Bottom line, the hotel is in an ideal location. With the windows opened, I could hear the accordian player - it just added to the ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: RandiSPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Even though the Albergo Cesari gets good reviews on Tripadvisor, I was still a little unsure of what to expect. I am used to traveling for business and staying in business class hotels. Fortunately, my worries were unfounded and we had a wonderful stay. We had a family room for 4 and it was very large, well air-conditioned, clean, very dark for sleeping and quiet. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance to so many of the major sites. But the best feature of the hotel was the rooftop bar and breakfast area. The rooftop was lovely. The breakfast was delicious, as were the drinks. One night, I read on a lounge chair for two hours while my family went to sleep. We were very pleased with this hotel and definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great breakfast on the patio, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: MattSconnie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved this place. I don't know how you would fine a better location, and the tasty breakfast on the patio is a great way to sit, relax, and plan your day in Rome. The staff was very helpful, answering all our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Dolce Vita”
Reviews.Author: Maalot
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean, excellent service in the rooms as well as breakfast and the highly qualified staff at reception: Berardo and Jan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, within walking distance of many attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Joyce025
Reviews.Content: This was a small hotel that was showing some age. The rooms are a decent size and very clean. The beds were hard, although I found this to be true throughout my trip. The location could not have been better. We could walk to the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and the Roman Forum. There was a family atmosphere. Lots of places to eat were nearby and shopping too. Rooftop breakfast was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: BLHoleman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo Cesari for four nights in May, and I am so glad we did. From the begining of our trip the hotel staff was nothing but accomodating. We arrived at the hotel at 9:00am and even though our room wasn't ready they immediately checked our bags, gave us a run down of the city layout, suggested a couple of places for us to visit and then invited us up to the rooftop terrace for breakfast! The breakfast was suprisingly very good, they had the biggest selection of food out of all the hotels we stayed at in Italy, and the terrace was amazing. It was so peaceful in the morning and was perfect for an afternoon drink before dinner. Our room was ready for us around noon and we were pleased to see that it was actually a good size. I had heard horrible stories from friends about how small european rooms are, but this one was more than enough for my husband and I. The staff was very attentitve to our needs as well. We accidently blew a fuse while we where there (I had forgotten to plug in my converter) and lost all electricity in our room, but we called to the front desk and they had it back up in about 5 minutes. Even though I was pleased with the rooms and the staff I must stay the best part of the hotel was the location!! We were literally right in the middle of all the major sights. It was a 5 minute walk to the Trevi, 5 miuntes to the panthenon, 10 minutes to the Collosseum, 15 to the Spanish Steps, and about 25 to the Vatican. We were able to walk everywhere on our trip, which helped save us money and confusion by not having to take buses. I have already recommended this hotel to a friend and I would definitley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location and comfort in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: lisak12
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Rome we took a taxi to our hotel, Albergo Cesari. We had reserved a standard double and prepaid for a reduced rate. I was glad we did not reserve a deluxe room, because our standard room was surprisingly large and very nice, a corner room on the 2nd floor with windows on two sides (double-paned, which blocked out the noise perfectly), with hardwood floors, a pretty view onto the square, a king-sized bed, and a spacious bathroom. Plus, it had a mini-frig. The hotel also had a very nice roofdeck, which was a bar at night and served a very good breakfast in the morning. The location was ideal, on a pedestrian-only street between Piazza Navona and the Trevi Fountain, very close to the Pantheon. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal family room”
Reviews.Author: Monkeypenny
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers stayed in a quad room. The room itself is quite lovely with polished wooden floors, a large bed for the parents with a single bed on each side for the children. Noise was not a problem as the sound proof glass worked very well. Bathtub leaked but once we had informed reception they were straight onto it. Heated towel rail was great for drying clothes on! Breakfast was lovely, plenty there for all tastes. I am a barista and very fussy about my coffee but "paulino" made a fantastic coffee for us each morning at no extra charge and we didnt need to buy a coffee the whole time we were in Rome. We walked all over the historic area from this hotel and even the kids didnt complain. I have only one complaint: the room was very hot and stuffy and the heating is automatic during "winter". I had to keep opening the window to cool the room down which was noisy. I asked at reception but they said it could not be turned off at this time of year. I don't tolerate the heat very well so it was pretty uncomfortable for me. We did love this hotel though, and I would recommend it for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MissMatilda
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel right in the middle of everything in Rome - close to the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, restaurants, shopping - walking distance to everything. The staff were great and enjoyed our attempts at speaking their language; very helpful and friendly. We loved the rooftop terrace. Our room was clean and comfortable, althought the European style double bed - two singles pushed together - is a bit hard to get used to. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location , location.”
Reviews.Author: Greensleeves
Reviews.Content: As so many reviewers have said,location is excellent. I especially liked the fact that the No 116 little bus stopped round the corner from Hotel. I had booked a basic single room and was given a double room,which meant I had plenty of space. However,it was very dark and looked out onto back street. I needed lights on at all times. No problems with any noise . Wardrobe was large and I was supplied with pole to reach hanging rail !Good safety deposit box. Toilet a bit reluctant to flush at times ,but not too bad. Toiletriies were a bit basic but acceptable. Breakfast was excelent and served on lovely terrace when weather permitted. I had looked forward to drinks on this terrace in the evening, but although made very welcome,few people used it,especially later at night. I suspect that the fairly hefty prices may have been the reason for this. It was not possible to use the terrace between 12.00 and 18.00,which seemed a pity. All in all though I enjoyed my stay. Staff were very friendly and internet in lounge very handy when ash cloud threatened my departure !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely terrace, but some TLC required!!!”
Reviews.Author: TrishLovesHabs
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a great location with a beautiful rooftop terrace, then this is the place for you. I'm not sure how much has changed since I visited last summer, but I will be taking a trip to Rome in the next few weeks and will not be staying here again. Sadly the thing that I remember most about this hotel was when I checked into my single room, there was a stool in the toilet that did not flush for two days. The upholstery needs some updating, and for some reason while I was there, two out of three lightbulbs in my room blew. When I asked them to change the bulbs, by the fifth day none had been changed. In addition, my aunt, mother and cousin who were in a triple room, had clogging issues with the tub. Water would collect until you were ankle-deep, so they had to use my shower. When we asked them at the front desk to do something about it, again nothing was done. However, you really can't beat the location for such a decent price, and the rooftop terrace was simply gorgeous. Sad that I can't get the image of that stool out of my head.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: alisonbob
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Clean and cozy room. Excellent breakfast. Loved the rooftop!!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen37
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and booked a superier single, howevever, was given a huge double room and loved it!! Staff are excellent, very helpful. Large selection at breakfast, and the rooftop area/bar really is a gem. Location is also excellent, being a genuine 5 min stroll from Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, and just a tad longer to the Cats of Roma at Largo Argentina, Piazza Venezia, and Piazza Navona among others. I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Rome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jpjFredrikstad
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Albergo Cesari hotel. We got a quad-room which was spacious with one double-bed and two single beds, a large wardrobe, two armchairs and a nice bathroom. All spotlessly clean. The breakfast was plentyfull and delicious, with a great variety of sandwichspread (even crispbread/rye crisp wich was very much appreciated) The location could not have been better! It is actually in the middle of "sentro storico". Step out of the hotel and walk right apx. 150 m. and you are at the Trevi Fontain, or walk left 100 m. and you are in the front of Pantheon. From Pantheon it is 200 m. to Piazza Navona. You can actually walk to every thing worth seeing. Piazza Venezia and piazza Campodogglio are just 3 blocks away. Forum Romanum and Colosseum about 10 min. We walked to Forum Romanum, Colosseum and the Spanish Step easily. To the Vatican city we went by metro from Piazza Barberini, but I gess it would take you apx. 30-40 min. by foot from the hotel. We highly recommend Albergo Cesari and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Redrebeltraveller
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here in Feb 2010. Having stayed in the lovely 4* Albergo Del Senato (just around the corner from here) in December '09 I did not expect this hotel (as a 3*) to be as good. In many ways it was actually better. The location was perfect for sightseeing and shopping, the room was a reasonable size with an unusually large bathroom, and the staff were all fantastic, especially Camillo who entertained us at the bar on arrival. One of the hotel's biggest selling points is the fantastic rooftop bar that was open even in February. We were also able to have our breakfast on the rooftop terrace because the weather was so good. All in all a fabulous hotel. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A really excellent 3 star -right in the heart of rome”
Reviews.Author: cradders
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Albergo Cesari 13th to 20th March. It is an exceptionally well run 3 star and is perfectly located 200yards from the Pantheon and 300 yards from the Trevi fountain and say half a mile from the forum. It has good size rooms- well furnished. The bathroom is good with a basic shower cabinet- but there is a powerful shower and always hot water. Towels and bed linen are changed daily. The rooftop breakfast and terrace area is beautifully done and a really good breakfast buffet is supplied and you can eat all you want. The area is very noisy-the windows are triple glazed -but if you want to sleep with some fresh air -then take some serious ear plugs (Boots wax plugs are perfect) Unless you stick to pizzas then eating in Rome is quite expensive (If you are changing Sterling). A small cappuccino was £3-£4. A decent bottle of Pinot Grigio was £20. A word of warning. An American reviewer mentioned he had been "shorted" after eating in a roadside restaurant close by. He did not name the restaurant-but unfortunately I found it. It is only yards from the hotel and is the "LA Locando Del Tempio". We had a good meal there -paid by Mastercard -I gave him a 20 Euro note and said "take 5 Euros" and in the half light (the tables are outside in Via La Pieta) he gave me change for 10 Euros. When I challenged him he did not argue at all and went straight to the till and gave me 20 Euros. Apart from that we had a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “If you come to Rome you have to stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travellinghobo77
Reviews.Content: I think my title says it all to be honest! I stayed for 5 nights at the Albergo Cesari hotel on Via Pietra. The location is absolutely superb, the Trevi Fountain is less than a 5 minute walk in one direction and the Pantheon and Piazza Della Rotunda a similar distance in the opposite direction with Piazza Venezia and the Coliseum no more than 15 minutes walk away.
