The furthest walk would be to the Vatican but again this is no more than half an hour and if you visit the market at Campo di Fiore you can split the walk almost in half (the market is well worth visiting!). The only minus mark that I could find was the initial welcome by the receptionist who was not very friendly. The rest of the staff MORE than made up for this and the rooftop bar manager Camillo is such a lovely character who made me very welcome and helped make my stay a very pleasant one indeed. The rooms are very clean and well presented and the bathroom more than adequate and also very clean. The breakfast was plentiful with an excellent choice of fruit juices, cereal, pastries, cakes, fruit, yoghurt, cold meat, tea, coffee and cheeses so there was always something tasty on offer! The immediate area of Via Pietra and Piazza de Pietra are very lively (quite noisy but the shutters and windows do block out most of the noise) with some nice little restaurants and a nice (if a little expensive) wine bar just around the corner. If you walk a little further towards Piazza Della Rotunda there is a small wine bar opposite the Rotunda restaurant which is more reasonably priced (if you don't mind drinking out of plastic glasses!) What more can I say except, Fantastico!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location/price/quality combo”
Reviews.Author: Daugman
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (parents and 2 teens) spent 5 nights here. We booked based on reading Tripadvisor and got exactly what we expected. Location is between Pantheon and Via Corso (less than 100 yds to either). Hotel is a typical Euro place; small lobby, small elevator, modest rooms. Ours was quiet (ok, winter, windows closed.). Hotel has a free lobby PC or 5 euro/24 hr use of wifi (coupon that lets your laptop connnect). Rooftop bar/garden is fantastic. While i only pick based on price or quality, this garden/bar is a fantastic place. And breakfasts up there were also fantastic. I cannot offer any downside to this place; i suspect if you want fancier rooms or more on site services, you might go elsewhere. But for comfort, this was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little dated”
Reviews.Author: avxflyer
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the hotel for four nights. We opted for the “superior double” room. While the price was a little high for what we received, we found the staff to be excellent, extremely helpful and fun to talk to. Situated in a prime location, it’s an easy walk to the sights of Rome. The room was in good condition but the furnishings showed their age. The bathroom was larger than most we experienced in Europe, however, the shower was extremely small. Breakfast was typical and without variety or high quality. Expect to pay for internet access every 24 hours and although they advertise a “happy hour” don’t expect a break on prices at the roof top bar. Just show up and be happy you’re in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Disappointed in Room Decor”
Reviews.Author: runt70094
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located to all the tourist sights, but it is an older hotel that could use a renovation. The rooms are sparcely decorated with old bathroom facilities. It is quite noisy and when we asked to be moved, we were told all the rooms were the same. The breakfast buffet there was not as good as the other hotels in which we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: kateoz
Reviews.Content: I don't think the location of Albergo Cesari could be bettered. It's 5 minutes in one direction to the Pantheon, 5 minutes in the other to the Trevi Fountain, 10-15 minutes to the Spanish Steps (not really sure how long exactly because we were distracted with shopping every time) and less than 1/2 hour to the Colosseum. The only time we took a bus was carrying luggage to and from Termini. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby (we liked Sabatino around the corner near the Church of Ignatius of Loyola - and the church itself is pretty cool with its fake dome, too). The Della Palma gelateria near the Pantheon was our favorite and we might have gone 4 times in 3 days. :) We had a handicapped-accessible room (not required, just coincidence) which was huge. As we were traveling as friends, we requested the bed be split into twins - unfortunately we had to ask twice but this was the only negative thing about the hotel. The bathrooms are not modern, but I never expect fancy bathrooms in Italy. They are fine and very clean. Despite being on a somewhat noisy piazza, given a very popular bar across the way, you could not hear any of this inside your room with the windows closed. Great soundproofing. Breakfast is very good - meats, cheeses, toast, pastries, cereals, fruit and yogurt. They will make coffee for you and there is also American filter. It's lovely to eat it on the hotel rooftop - and the bar there at night, although a little expensive, is great too. They gladly opened a bottle of wine we had bought elsewhere and let us drink it. We got a fantastic rate of 110 E per night, which made this hotel tremendous value. Would not hesitate to go back at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Cesari is a great combo of style and location!”
Reviews.Author: Linda Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and loved it! We could easily get the bus or walk to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, and much more. Much better than staying in the area where the bigger hotels are. The entrance is on a small alleyway with sidewalk seating for two restaurants (which are so-so) but convenient! Lots of pizza and deli places nearby as well as shopping. Tabacci shop very close to buy bus or metro passes. It has a lovely rooftop breakfast room and bar (very chic). The bar prices were a little high and they had minimal food, but nice view of one monument and quaint rooftops. Indoor or outdoor seating up there with couches and tables. Very romantic! The room was not as plush as some, but much better than others. Free computer terminal in the lobby. The staff was helpful with information on buses and taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great roof deck”
Reviews.Author: Ingmar53
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in at least a dozen hotels in Rome, usually preferring the Campo dei Fiori neighborhood. I had considered the Cesari before, but falsely assumed it was a little too far from the places we like to frequent. I was wrong. The Cesari is in a great location--just a block from the Pantheon and a short stroll to either Piazza Navona or the Trevi Fountain--if that overwhelmed area interests you. It's steps to Tazza D'Oro for the best espresso in the world and around the corner from il Falchetto, an old Roman restaurant we've been going to for decades. I was favorably impressed when staff greeted us warmly after we arrived early in the rain. While they couldn't give us our room at 9 am, they did everything to make us comfortable, secured our luggage and offered suggestions for how to pass the time until our room was ready. The room itself was adequate with comfortable beds, a roomy-enough bathroom with abundant hot water and in-room wifi (for a 5 euro daily fee). Large double-paned windows kept out most of the noise from the surrounding bustle. The real treat is the rooftop breakfast area and outdoor lounge. I had read reviews here that complained that bread was not included with breakfast. Unless you crave spongey American Wonder Bread, the breakfast buffet is bountiful with rolls, cornetti and other baked delights, along with a variety of cheeses, meats, fruit, yogurt, cereal and juices--one of the best breakfasts I've had at a hotel of this level. And the coffee is excellent (although Tazza D'Oro is just steps away.) And when the weather was cooperative, it was refreshing to have a relaxing mid-day rest or an evening grappa after dinner on the rooftop lounge looking out over churches and other Roman buildings. My only minor complaint was an unpleasant smell that seeped into the room while we were out. But we'd open the window upon our return, and all was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Cesari - Great location!”
Reviews.Author: deniuh
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in this gem of a hotel. We were pleasantly surprised by the location. It is in walking distance of the major sites, especially the Pantheon. We really enjoyed walking the neighborhoods and soaking up the flavor of Rome. This was our second time in Rome so we had already done the major sites. My husband thought the hotel layout was like a labaryinth. He hated having to figure out where the room was. I on the other hand liked that - the quaintness of it all. The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was large and clean but antiquated. If we were staying in Rome for an extended period of time, I am not sure I would have stayed here simply because of the outdated bathroom. There were nice touches in terms of their toiletries. There is a great rooftoop bar, newly renovated. It is beautiful and you can see the Roman rooftops. Breakfast was great - the hotel put together bags for us since we had an early flight. It was exceptional. The check in staff was not very friendly - that perhaps was our biggest disappointment. Although I loved the location, I did not get that warm fuzzy feeling that I usually get with small quaint hotels. We paid Euros 136 for the night which we thought was a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Hard bed.”
Reviews.Author: avvirish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Albergo Cesari for four nights during October. We paid 136 euros ($200 USD) per night for a double room with private bath. The location could not have been better; it is on Via di Pietra directly between the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. There are several good restaurants along the same block. Although the hotel is situated on a busy pedestrian street, with many tourists and vibrant night life, the street noise was not bothersome. The rooftop terrace is amazing. We enjoyed our breakfast there every morning, and the weather was perfect in the evenings for having a late night drink up there as well. Our only complaint about the hotel was the very hard bed (actually two single beds pushed together). By the end of our stay, we were both experiencing back pain and not sleeping well. But on the whole, we had a wonderful stay there. Breakfast was included, and we were able to check email on a computer located in the lobby. Wi-Fi was available for a fee. We also used the airport pick-up service provided by the hotel, which cost 55 euros for up to three persons and saved the hassle of moving our luggage by train. Our driver was very knowledgeable about Rome’s history, and he gave us a mini tour as we rode from the airport to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gogogaijingirl
Reviews.Content: great location - right in between the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. we got a corner room which had views over Piazza di Pietra, and was really spacious and felt quite luxurious - especially for the price in this location. The room also had bathrobes and slippers which is always a nice addition. Breakfast was good and although it was raining so we didn't use it the roof terrace was lovely. We only stayed for one night but will stay again next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Donna4Loans
Reviews.Content: I've been to Rome six times and never as happy with the hotel as I was this one! Whenever I go back, this will be my first choice. I loved it so much, I hesitated writing this review because I'm afraid I'll never be able to book it again! Everything about it was perfect! The room was large, with a high ceiling, refrigerator and air conditioning that worked very well. The bathroom was spacious and spotless. The breakfast was the most elaborate I've had in Rome with meats, cheeses, pastries, cereal and fresh fruit. The rooftop view was spectacular and the staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. The location is to die for! I'm 58, and not in the best shape and could walk everywhere! You are about 2/10ths of a mile in one direction to the Pantheon and same distance in the other direction to the Trevi Fountain. The street right at the corner is a major bus stop so if you did need a bus, they were very accessable. I was able to walk to St Peters and the Forum. From the corner, you look right down the street and see the Tomb of the Unkown Soldier. You walk out the door of the hotel and you are on a pedestrian only street with all kinds of shops and restaurants. One night when I walked out, there was a man playing the accordian in the street right outside the hotel. There is nowhere in Rome I would rather stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great refuge from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: PBGardener
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albergo Cesari in late September during the first leg of our Rome-Florence-Venice trip, and would highly recommend it. As numerous other reviewers have noted, the location is incredibly central, putting all of the major sights within easy walking distance. Your feet will still hurt after days of touring Rome, but the trek to the hotel is not part of the problem. For the incredible location, the price was also excellent -- we paid about 135E per night for three nights (cash price). The value for the money was incredible for a city as expensive as Rome. Our room was a standard double and while not enormous it was a perfectly serviceable base to explore the city, and the room was well maintained by the housekeeping staff (see photos). The soundproof windows were generally effective. Although we could still hear some noise from the restaurants below (we were on the 5th floor) and from garbage collection in the mornings, the windows muffled the sounds considerably. The front desk staff was friendly and all spoke English very well; they were also kind enough to give us access to our room upon our early arrival around 9:30 am. Hotel staff also quickly arranged a taxi to the train station upon our departure, which surprised us by pulling up directly in front of the hotel in the pedestrian area. We had already learned, however, that the pedestrian-only signs are mere suggestions in Rome, not requirements. The most remarkable feature of the hotel is the rooftop terrace where guests enjoy a plentiful breakfast, including the best hotel coffee (by far) that we experienced on our trip. The buffet was generous, with cold cuts, pastries, cereals, yogurt, fruit and more that varied a little each day to keep things interesting. The terrace also doubles as a wine bar in the evening, and it was a perfect place to relax after a long day of sight seeing and before restaurants opened ("real" Italian restaurants don't open for dinner until 7 or later; the ones that are open at 5:30 are generally catering to tourists and not as good). It was so peaceful on the terrace, and weather was perfect for us, so it gave us a chance to unwind and discuss all the exciting events of the day. Service at the wine bar was sketchy -- it was very hard to get the attention of the waiter at first -- but once we had our first glasses of wine we were showered with small snacks (olives, chips, cheese) and regular offers of refills. I have attached a photo showing a small portion of the roof terrace. We highly recommend Albergo Cesari. If you visit, there is a good and fairly authentic restaurant in the piazza in front of Saint Ignatius, located behind the building where the hotel is located. The restaurants directly in front of the hotel are geared to tourists, and while the food was relatively cheap and available when we were hungry early (5 pm), the quality was not great and our waiter "accidentally" shorted us a significant amount of change (10E / $15). We ultimately resolved this, but would advise travelers to take the time to find a better option for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anneeby
Reviews.Content: Best location, quiet, friendly, clean, big spotless bathroom, perfect rooftop location for breakfast, excellent attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel located in the historic centre with fabulous roof deck overlooking the neighbouring area.”
Reviews.Author: MertonKidd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated between the Trevi fountain and the Pantheon within easy walking distance of the main sights in the historical centre and has been in the same family for 3 generations. We had room 43 on the top floor, one level below the roof top breakfast and bar area. Apart from the usual Roman street noise it was nice and peaceful with a big bathroom. The staff are very helpful, speak good english and in the evening the barman is only too happy to mix you up a relaxing cocktail or aperatif. We had a great stay with the al fresco breakfasts on the spacious roof terrace a particular highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Foxboro1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at this hotel and enjoyed every aspect of the place. We travel a lot and had high expectations after reading the many positive reviews. We were able to get a great rate, four nights for the price of three. As others have stated, this really is one of the best locations in Rome, we walked everywhere. The roof deck is beautiful and breakfast was excellent. I didn’t realize that the deck was closed after breakfast and was not accessible until the bar opened at 5:00pm. We were very happy with this hotel and it is hard to any fault. Book early it fills up fast.

Reviews.Title: “Right In The Middle Of Everything and A Nice Roof Terrace”
Reviews.Author: BRSIMPSON
Reviews.Content: A birthday celebration brought us to Italy and Rome was on our last leg of the trip and this hotel was a delightful surprise and so convenient to all the attractions. One block away was the Trevi Fountain and one block the other way was the Pantheon. A 15 minute walk to the Roman Forum, 30 minutes to the Vatican and 20 Minutes to the Spanish Steps. The hotel has a nice roof terrace that serves drinks and light snacks. This area is also where the morning breakfast (delightful meats and cheeses and pastries) is served. The best coffee in a long time. The windows to your room are doubled to keep the street noise out. Save some Euro's for a taxi back to the airport by rolling your luggage to the Pantheon. There is a taxi stand beside it and it will not cost as much (40 Euro-Set Price) if you are using the hotel (55 Euro and Up) to book transportation. There are several restaurants to mention: Trinity College Bar (Irish Food and Drink One Block Over) which has the best steak and Guiness. The La Sagrestia (Near Pantheon) that serves the best pasta and the pizza restaurant behind the hotel (Name?/Next To Church) that serves the best antipasta presentation. Be very careful with bus transportation as pick-pockets will take your holiday joy away. Also if arriving by plane or train, go to the taxi stand for transportation. I say this because there will be people who will approach you for transportation and use their own car. The people who attend the front desk of the hotel speak english well and will be happy to help with directions to any sites. As a safety note, in large crowds, hold tight to your money. If you have any questions, please e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than "just" a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dcdriver
Reviews.Content: Yes, the Cesari is perfectly located halfway bet. the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain, but that's only part of what makes it a great hotel. It's a fantastic value, too - you get so much for the very reasonable price. The bed is big and comfortable, the windows are totally sound-proof, the water pressure is great, the bathroom is more than ample, the amenities are those of a more expensive hotel. And I haven't even touched on the rooftop breakfast, including boxed cereals, variety of juices, free cappucino, and fresh fruit, which is a perfect way to start every day. The hotel is professionally and pleasantly run, well maintained and quiet (despite its location on one of the busiest thoroughfares in the city). I'd return in a second and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with wonderful rooftop bar and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Italyiswonderful
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have had a better location in Rome! We were able to walk to all the main attractions w/i 20 minutes or so one way. The staff was extremely helpful and had no problem modifying our reservation when our flight out was pushed back a day. We arrived by 9 A.M. at the hotel and our room was ready for us and we were even offered the opportunity to go have some breakfast even though we hadn't stayed the night before. The room is small, but perfectly functional for what we needed and was spotless. The highlight is definitely the rooftop bar where you take breakfast and can have drinks in the evening. The breakfast had a nice arrangement of pastries, cereal, fruit, meats, and cheeses. With the map given to us at check-in we had no problem maneuvering around the city and it was wonderful to have the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain within a few minutes walk. There is a plethora of restaurants and shops all around the area and for a little longer walk, Piazza Navona was the perfect option for dining and gellato every day. Can't wait to go back and will definitely try to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Herbage
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel as part of our honeymoon in August. It's situated perfectly in the centre of Rome, so you don't have to walk far for sights, good food etc.. The rooms are exceptional and good size v.clean, air con v.good, sat. tv, mini bar. The bathrooms are a good size too. The staff are always friendly and happy. The prices for drinks are reasonable considering where you are. The breakfast in the morning is very good, good choices and topped up every 5 mins. There is also internet service available, which we didn't have to pay for. If you eat out, make sure you try the restaurant just outside, it's called Rosa and Rosae. The staff are very nice and fast with your food. The choices are excellent and you get quite good portions, plus it's only right outside! The Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon are quite near, so it's ideal if you can't walk far, you can still see the sights. We managed to get a good deal 4 people for 3 at this hotel, but it would have worked out reasonable anyway. Will definately go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: SheboyganBrotz
Reviews.Content: As noted by others, the location for this hotel is perfect, putting you right in the middle of all that ancient Rome has to offer. We found the rooms to be more than adequate. Nothing special, but nothing really wrong with them either. The staff was very helpful. The roof top terrace is gorgeous. Its the perfect way to start the day with breakfast, or end the day with a drink. We originally wanted a quad room, but when we voiced our concern about the kids sleeping on a pull out bed, they offered us a double room and a twin room (right next to each other) for the same price as the quad. That worked out great! I'll definitely stay here again when we return to Rome (and I know I will since I tossed a coin over my shoulder into the Trevi Fountain).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ArtQueenTexas
Reviews.Content: Albergo Cesari is in a great location- 5 minutes walking to Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. The family or quad. room for four people was clean and large, but one of my daughters had to sleep on what we consider a roll away type of bed or cot which was not as comfortable as the other twin. If you are particular about your bathrooms, this one was large enough, but was not ever well cleaned and we stayed at the hotel from June 30th to July 5th and then again July 13th to July 15th 2009. The front desk staff were extremely kind and helpful with directions and any other information we needed. The highlight was the beautiful bar and breakfast area on the roof. We had wine at 7:30 at the bar every evening before going to dinner and Carmelo, the bartender, was the best. He had great suggestions for dinner and introduced us to some wonderful Italian wines. Family of 4 from Texas

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location... Helpful & Friendly Staff... Awesome Rooftop Lounge!”
Reviews.Author: nraymer
Reviews.Content: My new hubby and I went to just got back from our honeymoon to Italy. We decided to stay two nights in Rome before picking up a cruise... Thankfully, we lucked out and stayed at the Hotel Cesari. First, the Hotel Cesari was in the BEST location in Rome. The hotel is on this little strip and you feel like you are in the heart of Italy! Everything can be reached by exiting the hotel and turning either left or right. To the right walk about 5 minutes and you’ll run into the Trevi Fountain and a 5 minute walk past the Trevi you will run into the Spanish Steps and the Metro Station. To the left of the hotel you run into ruins and then a few minute walk you hit the Pantheon and a little farther Piazza Navona. At night however, it is quiet. The hussle and bussle that goes on in the day stops at night, so you can sleep peacefully. We had two large windows in our room that opened up to the beautiful streets, tucked away in just the most perfect area! The free breakfast in the morning was amazing! It was an authentic breakfast with coffee, juices, homemade pastries, meat and cheese trays, and much more. It was truly the perfect way to start off the day. Not to mention the rooftop dining area overlooking the ruins and the gorgeous area! A beautiful spot to hang out morning-noon- or night :) The staff was so friendly! Since, we arrived early they were nice enough to keep our bags so that we could start exploring. They also helped us with directions, cab rides, etc. Everything you need they can help you with- they all speak great English. The hotel is also near a cute little store that has in expensive wine, cheeses, etc. Perfect to grab a bottle of wine to take back to the hotel to pop open! shhhh :)

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Cesari is the best value in Rome, a wondeful experience”
Reviews.Author: PandaNewZealand
Reviews.Content: I was advised of this hotel by someone who had been so impressed by it that she phoned to make my reservation, just to make sure I went. Albergo Cesari is situated in the middle of Rome in a gorgeous side street off the main shopping area. It is within walking distance of many historic attractions, e.g. 5 mins from the Coliseum, and has reasonably priced, quality cafe`s and restaurants at the doorstep. The rooms were small but clean and pleasant. They had an electric jug, fridge etc for tea and coffee making. Internet access for my computer cost only 5 Euros per day. The hotel also had the most wonderful buffet breakfast and this was taken at table on the rooftop, which is also a bar during the day/night. The views of other old rooftops from here was amazing. The staff were outstanding. They were friendly and obliging, nothing was too much trouble, and this helpful approach did not alter through changes in shift. When I visit Rome again, this is where I will stay. I have already recommended the hotel to several friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: KansasSunflower09
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Albergo Cesari. Staff was very friendly and helpful, with directions, reservations, etc. Room was beautiful with windows overlooking Piazza di Pietra. Triple- paned windows kept the noise out in the evening and at night. The rooftop terrace is gorgeous and we loved the breakfast buffet--always fresh croissants and sweet rolls, ciabatta rolls, bread, salami and prosciutto (so?) along with cheeses, fresh fruit, cereals, juices plus delicious cappucino. Service was always excellent and pleasant. Location is perfect--next to Temple Adriano, a couple of blocks either direction to Trevi Fountain or the Pantheon. We walked to almost everything we wanted to see in Rome. Room was very clean and nice. We LOVED this hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Understated Luxury”
Reviews.Author: MariaRilke
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior room for five nights in the second half of May - and was pleasantly surprised when I got there. Frankly, my expectations weren't that great; the location was smack in the centre, and I thought the room was going to be one of those claustrophobic shoe boxes. Wrong! The room, though not cheap at ~130 euros/night, was quite spacious with a small living room, a separate bedroom, and a spacious bathroom (the bathroom included little niceties such as shaving cream, cotton swabs, etc. that are not that common in "three-star" European hotels, at least in my experience). Service was impeccable at all times, polite and friendly, whether at the front desk or the breakfast room. The breakfast was on a rooftop terrace, which was a delight in itself in the sunny Roman mornings. Finally - and I can't stress this enough - the location was ideal in the best sense of the word. Even among central locations, this is really central. The Colosseum is a twenty-minute walk, the Vatican about twenty-five. The Pantheon is a few steps away; Piazza Navona is nearby as well. The Spanish Steps are twenty minutes away. Even the Villa Borghese can be reached within thirty minutes of walking. I never had to use public transportation during my stay there. The hotel is approximately a 15-20 - minute taxi ride from the Termini Station, depending on traffic. Overall impression: I can't think of any complaints - none - and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: Lol111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so central you could not be better placed. It is only five mins from Trevi fountain. The restuarants outside the hotel are good value too. The breakfast room is located on the roof which is fantastic. The quality of the breakfast was fantastic, Kellogs cereals in sealed boxes - none of this dip into a bowl! The staff were extremely friendly and could not do enough for us, the rooms were spacious and clean. We would not stay anywhere else in Rome and would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this location!!”
Reviews.Author: Pieces3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Albergo Cesari during our short stay in Rome. We just finished a 10 day cruise and wanted to stay in Rome for a couple of days. We wanted a hotel that was walking distance to most of the famous sites in Rome and we got just that. It was perfect. Great hotel choice for a short stay. The hotel staff was pleasant enough but I wouldn't rate them as friendly. They did speak English well and they do provide maps for your stay in Rome which was helpful. The hotel is located on a lovely side street across from a couple of cafe`s, vendors and souvenir stores. The cab will let you off just a few steps away from the hotel. The street that the hotel is situated is for pedestrians only. Depending on what room you get, it can be noisy at night. The only thing that bothered us was that they do ask to see your passport when you arrive. They will enter what information they need from your passport into their data base and give it right back to you. When we questioned them, they stated that it was a law in Rome to show your passport on arrival at any hotel. We also stayed at the Crowne Plaza for one night before our cruise started and they did not ask for our passports. So, not sure why only some hotels request for this information. We enjoyed our buffet breakfast at the roof top terrace. It was a lovely view while enjoying our cappuccino. The buffet was a nice mix of fruit, pound cake, apple strudel, croissants and cornflakes.....nothing fancy. No bread.....you have to ask for bread which I thought was unusual. The selection they had was more than enough to start your day. Breakfast starts at 7am.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome, Wonderful Rooftop, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: WNY_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: Been to Rome before and stayed in Trastevere last time. Wanted a more central location this time and Albergo Cesari definitely fit the bill. Everything was close by and was just far away enough from Via Corso that I heard no noise. The rooftop is modern and very spacious. The view is relaxing and it is a nice place to wind down after a long day. Breakfast was also served upstairs and the selection was more than adequate. The reception staff was very friendly and when I chose to extend my stay the staff went out of their way to make sure I stayed in the same room. Friendly and efficient. My only complaint is that the shower stall was quite small but the room was large enough. Albergo Cesari was an excellent value for the location and amenities. I would definitely recommend it to any one visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, but the room wasn't much”
Reviews.Author: Formerca
Reviews.Content: My first thought on being shown our room (two twin beds) was, "Why on Earth did TWO guidebooks recommend this place?" I figured the "superior" rooms must have been a lot better. The room was extremely small and dark. The only place to open a suitcase was on the bed. There was no dresser or drawers, so unpacking wasn't an option. But, we weren't in Rome for the hotel room. The hotel rooftop breakfast room and patio were GORGEOUS. I loved being up there looking over all the tile rooflines and church spires and domes. Absolutely gorgeous. The breakfast was fine, but nothing fancy. The hotel staff was courteous, but I wouldn't call them friendly. The location of this hotel cannot be beat. My 13 year old son and I walked EVERYWHERE and I don't think any place was more than a 20 minute walk, even the Vatican. The narrow maze of cobblestoned streets surrounding the hotel were absolutely delightful. There were tons of places to eat and to do a little shopping. We absolutely loved Rome. Our pokey little hotel room wasn't able to diminish our joy even one little bit.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Roma, Italy”
Reviews.Author: Kaza80
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I stayed there for 3 nights, while I was by myself in Rome for work back in October 08. From the moment I arrived at the hotel (bright and early in the morning) my room was ready straight away. I walked into my room, which was just a standard room and it was amazing, nothing I could have imagined, the bedroom was huge and so was the bathroom, ultra clean but very old school, hey its to be expected, you in Rome. My room was on the corner of the building, so I had windows everywhere. Directly below my window was a couple of restaurants and yes you could hear people talking into all hours of the night, but to me that was magical, because not only could I hear all the gorgeous Italian accents downstairs but I could hear some of the men, start to breakout and sing in Italian from time to time, it was truly spectacular. The Albergo Cesari I felt was in one of the best locations in Roma, 5 minutes walk one way was the Pantheon and less then 5 minutes walk the other direction was The Trevi Fountain. It is alright basically right in the centre of Rome so you can walk everywhere. All the tour companies picked up from my hotel as well, so that was great. On the top floor of the hotel is where Breakfast is served, this was spectacular because you literally over looked all roof's surrounding you. The only thing was breakfast started at 7am each morning and if you were leaving early any more for a tour (ie. The Vatican) you couldn't get any breakfast even though you had already paid for it. But oh well, that was the only down fall and I could live with it. I am a Travel Agent and I have been sending all my passengers to stay at this hotel since I have returned home from my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dragoer
Reviews.Content: We spent our Christmas holidays (2008) at the Cesari hotel. The hotel is situated in the very heart of Rome - in walking distance to all the famous attractions. There are plenty of good restaurants in the area. The first room we got was not very spacious. The walls were very thin so we could hear almost everything our neighbours said. But after one night we got a bigger and better room. All the staff we met were very friendly and very service minded. Breakfast was good with a variety of bread, cheese, ham, fruit and juice. There is a very nice roof terrace - must be lovely in the summer time. Overall I would say this is the very best hotel we have ever stayed in when visiting Rome and we will definitely come back. Negative comments: The shower cabins are covered with much mould - this should be removed or the shower cabins should be replaced with new ones.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: snarkyfish
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in December of 2005. The rooms were clean and pretty, and the location was right near the Pantheon. I've seen complaints about the noise on here, but I didn't notice anything. Then again, I'm from New York. The one thing that I would do differently next time is that I would avoid getting the breakfast if I could avoid it. It was included in our package last time, so I was sort of stuck with it. The buffet was large and varied, but the quality was nothing special, and there's no reason to eat such a huge breakfast. It's especially pointless given that the wonderful coffee shop Tasso D'Oro is right nearby, and you could have some of the most amazing coffee in the world and a lovely little pastry each morning for much less than the hotel breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: preciosa919
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon, and were very pleased by this hotel! The location cannot be beat! It is within walking distance from the subway (which was awesome!!) and many tourist spots like the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and Spanish Steps. The concierge was very helpful, especially Benny, who went above and beyond to make sure we had a great trip (Excellent restaurant recommendations, booking our train tickets on line, etc). The breakfast is also pretty good in the morning. It is not the fanciest hotel by any means, but the location and service make up for it! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed impressions”
Reviews.Author: Dann58
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the hotel is well located for exploring Rome by foot, the breakfast on the roof terrace was very good, the general decor and cleanliness were good and the staff were friendly and helpful. However, the room (a single) and bathroom were very pokey and poor value compared to other places I've stayed in Rome, it's almost impossible to get into the shower and close the concertina screen, despite getting a "quiet room" it was quite noisy from other guests going to and fro and it is on a busy tourist walking route with restaurants down at street level, for some reason it was often difficult to get hot water during my stay(although it did come through after several minutes and much fiddling with the taps) and I had to return to the hotel after I'd checked out to collect laundry that wasn't delivered the evening before.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great roof garden”
Reviews.Author: intrepidvoyager1
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Cesari. The location is central and very convenient. Out room was very large (we had a triple), clean and quiet (though the furnishings were a little dated - but I think they are progressively updating the rooms). The roof garden was beautiful - a great place for breakfast or a drink - and the breakfast was very nice. The staff were friendly. Internet access was available. We had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “location good but noisy”
Reviews.Author: CheshireTess
Reviews.Content: just spent few days at the cesari hotel good location but was spoilt by the noise despite asking for a quiet room when booking we were put on the first floor overlooking the restaurants on both roads. was okay thursday night went quiet about 12,00 but fri and sat night just never stopped. hotel has double glazing but not good enough when we mentioned to the manager he just said rome is noisy. would not stay there again last time we stayed in rome we stayed near the termini and it was bliss compared to this. room was okay food was good. just spoilt by the room we were given management not very interested. cheshire

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location in All of Rome!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vigo152
Reviews.Content: The Albergo Cesari, by far, has the best location in all of Rome! We stayed her for 3 nights and truly enjoyed our stay! The hotel is located 2 blocks from the Pantheon and 2 blocks from the Trevi Fountain and all of its surroundings. It's just a 10 minute walk to the Vittorio Emanuele II Monument and the surrounding landmarks (Roman Forum and Colosseum). The hotel room itself is comfortable and clean. The only reason why I did not give it 5 stars is because the bathroom had a bit of mold, but it was very minimal. In addition, the hair blow dryer wasn't the greatest... so girls...BYOB (bring your own blow dryer!). The staff was very nice and helpful providing us with great directions on how to get around the city and providing us with great dining recommendations. Jan, at the front desk, was extremely helpful and helped us schedule our pick up at the airport. He was very responsive and provided us with great service. The hotel has a beautiful terrace and bar in the top floor that has beautiful views and a great ambiance. My husband and I would go up every night before we went out on the town for a glass of wine. It was a great way to start our night! We would highly recommend for everyone to stay in this hotel. Great location, great price and great service . . . what more can you ask for??

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGTG
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the hotel. Right in the heart of rome...a short walk to the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooftop terrace very nice. Our room was basic, nothing fancy and small, but clean and it worked for us. Hotel will arrange for a car to pick you up at the airport (60 Euro) well worth it. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CoraSue
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Italy, a birthday present from my dad. I was with my mother, sister and daughter. My daughter and I shared one room and my mother and sister shared another. Our room was wonderful, everything was new and the view of the street below was wonderful. The staff at the hotel was very accommodating. This hotel is centrally located to every site in Rome. It is very close to the Pantheon, the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, the Colliseum.. and more.. This hotel is also close to street markets and shopping. The bakery down the street Forno, makes excellent sandwiches on delicious foccacia bread.. and the gelati is to die for....YUM.. all within a few steps from the hotel. We all loved the plentiful breakfast on the terrace in the morning and enjoyed drinks in the evening also.. Belini's were molto bene!!! I definitely want to bring my husband and son back to visit this spectacular city and stay at this wonderful hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Small Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jimbwa
Reviews.Content: My family and I (plus two of our adult children's friends) had three rooms at the Albergo Cesari at the end of July after 2 weeks at a villa in the Italian countryside. I thought the rooms might feel cramped after the villa, but they were very comfortable, and recently renovated. The air conditioning was fabulous, especially welcome in July in Rome. The Trevi Fountain and the Spanish steps are just a short stroll away, and most other sights are within walking distance as well. The staff at the front desk was very helpful - and spoke English quite well (great for us since our Italian was limited!). They made restaurant reservations for us, suggested an inexpensive place around the corner for a late evening meal sitting outside (quite nice, and we had a great time), and mapped out directions each morning for our sightseeing. Breakfast is served on a large patio area on the rooftop which was just recently opened, and it's a great spot. You can get a cappuccino with your meal (which I loved) and in the evening the area is a bar with snacks. Great way to unwind before heading out for dinner. We would certainly go back to this hotel - had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, just beautiful!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FrederickH
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 6 day stay at Cesari. Location of hotel is just outstanding. Hotel is located just off Piazza Di Pietra on a queit street with no cars. About 3 blocks from the Pantheon and 3 blocks from Trevi Fountain. You can just walk to everything. The front desk was just great and very accomodating. From suggesting restaurants, to reserving musems or just getting a taxi right to the front door. The hotel has two no smoking floors. We stayed on the 4th floor with our room overlooking the piazza. The room was quite large and the air conditioning was unbelievable. It was so cold we had to turn if off at night. The hotel staff told us the entire AC system was replaced in the last year. The highlight of the hotel is the brand new rooftop terrace. Breakfast was served everyday on the terrace. Large selection and cappucino or expresso included. At night, the rooftop terrace was open for cocktails from 5PM to midnight. Just spectacular. We could not have been more happy with this hotel. Some posters have written about the hotel and furniture looking a bit worn, but I don't know what they are talking about. This was a perfect small Italian hotel right in the middle of everything. Would reccomend it to anyone and would absolutely stay there again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location but little else”
Reviews.Author: gimonster2
Reviews.Content: The Albergo Cesari is in a great location (right between the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon), but that's really all it has going for it. The rooms are of a decent size, but they are by no means "clean." The "freshly laundered" sheets and towels were covered in hair every day. The furniture is rather old and worn, and my room smelled like burning peanuts the whole time I was there. I traveled all around Italy for two weeks, and the breakfast buffet here was the worst I had during my trip. You won't be in your room much in Rome, but I'd search for other hotels before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Albergo Cesari”
Reviews.Author: Bilyana72
Reviews.Content: The location of Albergo Cesari is perfect for exploring the historical part of Rome - we were able to walk to all places of interest, including some lovely restaurants in Trastevere. We were lucky to get upgraded to a superior room after a problem with the sink in our standard room and although the bathrooms were exactly the same (spotlessly clean but showing some age), the superior room was much bigger and brighter, with lovely new furniture. One of the best things about the hotel is its great new roof terrace where we took our breakfast (very good choice of cold meats, cheese, bakery, fruit, etc) and which works as a bar in the evening. All the staff was very courteous and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Really cosy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kaptah
Reviews.Content: Really nice n cosy hotel in a quiet part of the street. Very good breakfast area, rooftop. The only negative thing is that if U live on the first floor, as I did, U hear all the noice from the reception very easily :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Polodriver
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location and because of the good reviews it has received. We weren't disappointed. Friendly and helpful staff, compact perfectly formed room with excellent facilities, wonderfully comfortable bed, very useful working safe, and so on. No complaints. Breakfast was great and it was a plus to be able to sit outside on the rooftop terrace on our second morning and soak up the sun. Will def. return here one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Andersons00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in this hotel, which has a great location. It is located on the Via di Pietra within 3 blocks of the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain. We found it very easy to walk to most of the site in central Rome from the hotel. This included the Forum, the Spanish Steps, the Piazza Navona and the Campo De Fiori. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. And, there are two stores where one can purchase groceries. Our room was very comfortable with a firm bed and extra pillows. There was a large wardrobe for clothes, but not much dresser space (tiny drawers). The windows had shutters that could be closed to block out light and sound for an easier sleep in a busy city. The staff was very helpful, fluent in English and patient with our attempts at Italian. The breakfast was lovely. Standard Italian offering of cappicino, breads, pastries, hard boiled eggs, cereals, juice, fruit, etc. It was served on the 5th floor, where the hotel has also built a lovely roof-top patio area. (It was raining while we were there so we didn't get to take advantage of it.) Some of the reviews I read complained about the size of the breakfast area, but there were plenty of tables and it was never crowded. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants the convenience of walking to various sites in the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location....good value”
Reviews.Author: fisham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cesari for three nights in February 2008. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel is in an ideal location for visiting Rome. Our accommodations though somewhat on the small side, were perfectly adequate and the front desk was attentive to all our needs. There has been a major renovation on the rooftop, and instead of a crowded breakfast room downstairs, there is a fabulous new roof top terrace which makes it a joy to have breakfast in the morning. I would certainly stay in the Cesari again just to eat breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Situated”
Reviews.Author: lovfam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central, giving easy access to all the sightseeing you could wish for in Rome, between the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain, (each about 5 mins walk) Great attention to detail for a comfortable stay, nothing is too much trouble and the reception staff are helpful and polite. The hotel is situated in a great area for eating out, with many reasonably priced restaurants situated within two mins walk, some being right outside the hotel. A quiet area of Rome ideal for everyone wanting to visit the main attractions. Comfortable and warm, we didnt want for anything although on the downside the breakfast room (breakfast was included in the price) is VERY small and not adequate for the hotel - the tables and chairs are very close together and all but tea and coffee is self service - a scramble every morning( although the breakfast was good for choice and quality). Having said this the hotel on the whole is very good value for money and we would go back without hesitation. Can recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CypressVancouver
Reviews.Content: We (my spouse and I) stayed at the Hotel Cesari for 4 nights in mid-October, the last of 5 locations in Italy over 3 weeks. We were impressed. The room (31) faced Via Pietra and was clean and well-fitted, the only thing to note is that virtually all the doors squeaked when opened. Bathroom and shower were fine. Breakfast was one of the best of the 5 that we tried, no problem with multiple cappuccinos and the fruit was ripe and tasty. Day reception staff were very helpful, sorting through a surprise 1 day taxi strike and arranging an early morning car to the airport for our departure. Night (after 16:00) reception was a little different, not as friendly and preoccupied. Location, location, location, as other reviewers have noted for sight seeing is outstanding, but how about the 3 bars and 2 ristorantes right outside the hotel? At night the window had to be closed to keep out the street noise but the A/C worked fine. After being repeatedly warned about pickpockets in Rome, we instead found police almost everywhere. Overall, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: samhl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay but one of the staff had a weird manner and the carpets were very dirty. The rooms did not have very good beds and the showers curtains were broken. The breakfast was not that good either it did not have much of the way of healthy things like fruit which were unripe. Apart from that it had great location basically minutes walk from numbers of main attractions in Rome. Altogether i would not entirely recommend this hotel you could find quite alot of better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: lifeissweet
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Rome staying three nights here. It was such a quaint hotel located close to everything. Approximately three blocks from the Trevi Fountain. Three blocks from the Panethon. One block to the Corso where you could get all the bus lines. Our room (#43) overlooked the pedestrain street below lined with cafes. We had a newly renovated room which was quite spacious, large bathroom and immaculate. Bathrobes and slippers were provided for your comfort. I was concerned with other reviews regarding the dining area for breakfast. But it was quite adequate serving a traditional "Italian breakfast" - Meats, cheeses, eggs, fruit, bread, pastries, etc. Excellent cappuccino!!!!! They are still in the construction mode for the rooftop dining area. I took a peek. It will be wonderful when it is finished, but didn't hamper our stay. The staff was always helpful in any of our requests. If there was a down side (which this is a stretch) If your windows are open at night you will hear noise from the street and cafes. But you are in the city on the fourth floor. You are going to hear the city!!! What a great time and location, location, location. I definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best location in rome!”
Reviews.Author: LENA60
Reviews.Content: my husband and i have just returned from a three night stay here with three other couples. could not recommend the hotel more highly. It has the best location you're likely to find in rome. five minute walk to trevi fountain and same distance to pantheon in the opposite direction. our bedroom was very clean and spaciousand although the breakfast room is small, we never had trouble finding a table and the food is all fresh and well presented and with excellent cappuccino. reception staff were very heplful,booking taxis, which by the way are very reliable in rome, and making restaurant reservations for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Locaiton”
Reviews.Author: DandNSouthington_CT
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights from July 7 through July 10 and were very satisfied with the room and the hotel. I read so many negative reviews about the tiny breakfast room that I was pleasantly surprised when I saw it. The four of us never had a problem finding a place to sit and didn't mind that the breakfast wasn't up to American "standards". Who cares? We were in Rome! And what a great location, location, location. We would definitely stay there again if we return to Rome. Did I mention the great location? Right off the Via del Corso, minutes from the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navonna. We walked to the Colloseum, the Tiber, the Campo di Fiori, the Villa Borghese Partk, Hard Rock Cafe, Spanish Steps, etc. etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeenthereChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Staff was very helpful. They made Borghese Gallery reservations for us; gave excellent restaurant recommendations. They were always pleasant and helpful. Room was clean, nice decor. Breakfast was excellent. Would definitely recommend and stay here again. Location is a big plus, close to Trevi Fountain and Pantheon. You can walk anywhere in Rome from here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Velvet_escape
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2007. The best thing the albergo has to offer is its location, right in the centre of old Rome, next to Hadrian's Tample and a short walk from the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. I booked a single room and was pleasantly surprised to find a spacious room and bathroom, and a chilled bottle of Prosecco waiting for me. It was evident that the hotel had taken great measures to reduce the noise levels from the busy street below, however, the walls between rooms, and the corridor were not sufficient in blocking out the noise from activities of other guests. I also found the breakfast room incredibly small. I had no choice but to grab a few bits from the buffet and head back to my room. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel for short stays in Rome because of its excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, SMALL room”
Reviews.Author: taylorb1949
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo Cesari for one night right after Christmas 2006. Despite what the website says, the construction work is still going on, so consequently we had a nice view of scaffolding. The hotel website boasts soundproof rooms because of the location along a busy street. The rooms were definately soundproofed FROM THE OUTSIDE, but the interior walls were paper thin. A few other negatives were the small bedroom with an even smaller bathroom, and the awful downstairs bar. The positives were the location, the front desk staff, and the (one) free computer with internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Cesari”
Reviews.Author: hula1girl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at this hotel and find the location absolutely the best. The staff has always been very helpful and friendly. The breakfast has a good selection. Though the breakfast room is very small, it has allowed us to meet other travelers as we are seated so close to each other.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: carboNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We were told the Air Conditioning would be working during our stay from June 23 to June 26 and that the entire system would be overhauled starting June 27. Needless to say the A/C didn't work at all. Without the A/C and extreme noise, you can forget about sleep. The staff and location were excellent. If you advertise A/C, please make sure it's working!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location..dirty bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Cathy47
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on our 10 day visit to Italy. We stayed here for 3 nights and rented two rooms, one for our kids and one for us. The bathrooms in both rooms were tiled and the grout between all the tile in the floor and the walls was dirty. There was even crud on the light switch which I simply wiped off with tissue. The breakfast was in a very, very small room for the size of the hotel. The breakfast crew was unfriendly. This hotel was the most expensive one we stayed at while in Italy and it was definitely the worse. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location!”
Reviews.Author: ljmmpd
Reviews.Content: The Location about 100m to Pantheon and 200m to Trevi Fountain is excellant. It is on a busy but cute side treet. We had NO problems with noise as the windows were double glazed and had shutters. The room was a good size and had great views. We were lucky enough to get the top corner room as it was our honeymoon. They even gave us complimentary champagne! We walked everywhere: Vatican, Colesseum, Trastevere including with our back packs to and from Termini so no need for Taxis/buses etc which is great. Yes the breakfast room is a bit small but the food is good and staff friendly. Reception staff are ok, given no-one attempts to speak Italian to them! We didn't really ask them anything so don't know if they were excellant or not. Price is expensive, although Rome is VERY expensive and for location its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Middle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right in the center of Rome - minutes from the Trevi fountain and the Pantheon Excellent continental breakfast - very pleaseant and helpful staff Rooms small - but expect that in Rome- However very clean and quiet. Recommend a stay here. Dont be put off by the outside appearance as it needs a little paint - more than made up for on the inside. Close to everything

Reviews.Title: “Noise was unbearable”
Reviews.Author: chocco
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a month in Italy. Our first three nights were at the Albergo Cesari. While the hotel is situated in a convenient location (between the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon), we will never stay there again, as the noise level is unbearable. We slept very little each night due to a street cleaning truck that came around at 3 or 4 a.m. followed by a garbage truck that ran for what seemed like hours. Also, the restaurant across the narrow street has an alfresco area where customers sit and laugh and talk while the waiters bang and clang dishes until late into the evening. The desk manager was perfunctory, at best, but not very friendly. From now on, we will stay at The Hotel S'Anna on Borgo Pio (at the Vatican) where it is quiet and we can get some sleep after all the day of walking and touring.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit pricey!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean. But the walls are thin. We could hear everything going on on the second floor. The best part is the location which is tucked away by the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain. Not so touristy and crowded by via veneto. The breakfast (which is included in price) was nothing special. The people at the hotel are not the warmest, but all in all we were statisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a break at this hotel in late April and were more than pleased! It is right in the middle of the tourist area and all sights are within walking distance (turn left out of the hotel and within 100 yards is the pantheon, turn right and the trevi fountain is 200 yards away!) The hotel is very clean and the staff are very friendly. Yes it is noisy at night but you are in the middle of a city with lots of traffic(although the hotel is in a quiter side street) but the hotel has double glazed windows and if you are hyper sensistive sound proof shutters on the inside. However both my wife and myself were able to sleep with the windows just open a little bit. I would recommend this hotel for anyone and am looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandBuckeye
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March for 3 nites. We had two rooms because there was 4 of us. Our room was very nice and spacious plenty of closet space. My parents room was a little smaller and bit noisy from some loud people next door management called them and they didn't listen and finally settled down at 4:00 am. The hotel was clean. The LOCATION was incredible for us first timers to Italy. Walk to Piazza Novona, Pantheon, coloseum, ect... The breakfast was great compared to some other we had in Italy. MOst places give a (one) cappucino, croisant and fruit. Cesari had rolls, cheeses, meats, pastries, fresh juices, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, unlimited cappucinos, and service with a smile. We rebooked for our return to Rome on our last night rather than stay at the airport. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: PASAVANT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cesari for Seven nights beginning; on March 20, 2006. The hotel is wonderful. Clean, friendly staff, good breakfast, and the location is perfect.We walked everywhere except to the Vatican and to the Borghese Gallery. Get a room looking out onto the Piazza di Pietra ( we had room 18). It is fun to watch the people in the square. The shutters and windows block out the noise so there was not problem sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, able to walk to all major attractions”
Reviews.Author: benkaylamum
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed for 4 nights in August last year. I did a lot of research on the various hotels in Rome as there is so many to choose from and I believe it can be a hit or miss to pick somewhere good. We had a lovely spacious room, which was extremely clean as was the bathroom (although it could do with some updating). Although there was a lot going on in the streets below, when you closed the shutters, you could hardly hear anything. The breakfast room was pretty small but there was a good selection of meats, cheeses, breads, cereals etc to set you up for the day ahead. The hotel's location is superb. On arriving, we left our luggage in our room and went for a wander, what a surprise as we rounded a corner within a few minutes of leaving the hotel, and there, in front of us, was the Trevi Fountain all lit up at night. We walked everywhere, even to the Vatican and the Colloseum. With the Pantheon and Piazza Navona within minutes in one direction and he Spanish Steps in the other, what more could you ask for? There is also a beautiful wooden toy shop on the street leading from the hotel to the Pantheon, well worth a visit, even if you don't have kids!!! We were also exceptionally lucky in that we got to shake hands with Pope Benedict. Due to the time of year we were there (August), he was holding his general audiences on a Wednesdays in the audience hall which is situated to the left hand side of St Peter's Square. We had some "inside information" and we were advised to go really early to queue which we did at around 7am, and we weren't the only ones, there were already a couple of hundred people there. The audience was due to start at 10am. We were advised to get seats nearest the aisle as possible as the Pope on the previous week had walked down and shaken peoples hands. We were lucky enough to get next to the aisle and true enough, the pope shook our hands on the way down. One word of warning for all tourists in Rome, ensure your money and valuables are secured on your person. I had heard that pickpockets were rife and this seemed to be the case, especially on public transport, we saw someone trying to steal out of a ladies handbag on the bus we were on going to Termini. Don't let that put you off though as I would definitely return to Rome again in the future and my first choice would be the Albergo Cesari!!

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Cesari - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CasperAdventures
Reviews.Content: The location COULD NOT have been better! The Albergo Cesari was the perfect choice for us in Rome! Step out of the hotel and walk 2 blocks right... you run into the Trevi Fountain...walk 2 blocks left and you run into the Pantheon. Several great piazza centers within EASY walking. We walked to the Spanish steps easily (or grab a cab if you REALLY don't like walking at all). We took the metro from the Spanish steps to the Vatican area. There was some street noise, but as a light sleeper it didn't bother me... in the middle of Rome, you're going to hear Rome! Highly recommended! We would definitely stay at the Albergo Cesari again!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, centrally-located hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Parkie1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the last 4 nights of our trip to Italy in the centrally-located Albergo Cesari. Operated since 1787, it is housed in a brown-stuccoed building (complete with some missing exterior plaster) a short block south of busy Via del Corso, the main street between Piazza Venezia and Piazza del Popolo, and on the main pedestrian route between the Fontana di Trevi and Pantheon (each about 5 minutes away). The area is filled with restaurants and shopping. A 15 minute walk north will take you to the fancy designer stores and eating establishments near the Spanish Steps and 10 minutes west is Piazza Navona with more expensive cafes. Just south of the latter is Campo de Fiore, with lots of fruit, vegetable, and clothing stands as well as cafes. Equidistant from the hotel is the Roman Forum area which sits just south of Piazza Venezia. The Vatican is on the west side of the river, about a 30 minute brisk stroll from the hotel. We walked everywhere, only taking a cab from our rental car drop-off point in the parking lot of Villa Borghese to the hotel and from the hotel to the airport (the front desk staff arranged a limo for us and he was a delight, a friendly limo driver with fine English skills). The hotel decor is conservative and a bit dull, the formal wood furniture and long draperies and bedspreads in striped green and yellow matching well with the wooden floors. Our room was very large and could actually accommodate two other guests with the chairs that open into beds. Windows were provided with heavy panes and shutters that worked well to keep out the noise and light (while one street in front of the hotel is strictly pedestrian, the adjacent Piazza di Pietra and other streets do serve motorscooters, taxis, and some other vehicles, so there is city noise, including the early morning when the street sweepers come out). There was plenty of storage space in a wardrobe and drawers. The bathroom was a bit dated but very clean; the hot water was slow to develop in the morning when everyone was waking up. The halls kind of wander around with steps here and there, but an elevator is provided to eliminate most, if not all of them, depending on your room location. The breakfast room on the 1st floor has 10 small tables; food consisted of cheeses, meats, fruit, breads, and pastries. Staff was friendly and very professional, making restaurant suggestions and reservations if asked. A computer in the lobby was available for guest use (sign up at the front desk to gain access to it), but was popular and not always unoccupied. Make sure you walk one block south of the hotel to see the charming Piazza Sant'Ignazio which looks like a freshly-painted stage set and the Galleria Alberto Sordi just northeast of the hotel, which is a handsome, recently-restored interior shopping "mall". The Colosseum, a 30 minute walk away, is well worth a visit; make sure to save time to look at the museum located on the upper arcade near the elevators, which has a nice selection of Greek and Roman building ornamentation, stone friezes, and pottery. The city is fun to walk; we even happened to be in the Piazza San Pietro when the Pope was making his Wednesday late-morning blessing of the crowd. And as we were leaving on our last day, a large crowd was peacefully gathering with colorful banners at the prime minister's residence a block away in support of farmers. The Albergo Cesari was a fine, reasonably-priced and well-located hotel for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: janisc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July for 3 nights. This was our second time staying here. We have recomended it to several friends and all agree its got a great location, you can walk to all the sights and the front desk staff speak excellent english and are most helpfull. There is free internet in the lobby as well. The lobby is looking a bit tired so a reno soon with the furnishings might be in order, but thats not the reason your there anyway. We would again stay here, its a great place and you can pop in easily through out the day to change or drop your camera off etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming old fashioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: oceanlover0327
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Albergo Cesari for 4 nights in September 2005. The location is perfect - right in the heart of Old Rome, within walking distance to the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Campo dei Fiori, Fontana di Trevi and Piazza di Spagna. Via di Pietra is charming with sidewalk restaurants lining the tiny street. The hotel is right next to a building with the ancient facade of Hadrian's Temple. Rooms are clean and comfortable with old fashioned furniture that fits in with the historic atmosphere of the hotel. Bathrooms are modern with gorgeous blue tiles. Very good breakfast with a variety of choices to suit all preferences. Staff was helpful in a businesslike way. Room rates are a little high for my budget as a single traveller but the price was worth it for the convenient location. I would stay here again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights. Charming hotel. Small, boutique, on low traffic alley/street. Staff helpful but stoic & business-like. It's a great little hotel with no "wows" but a comfrtable, great, cozy location. Very clean. Noise-proof shutters worked well. I'd stay there again. Take them up on their car service from the airport. The driver, Franco Cantoni, is a gem of a man & his Mercedes service cost less than a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Prego!”
Reviews.Author: flycreek
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Italy with my husband and teenage son and spent the first three nights and last night of our trip at the Cesari. What a great way to start and end our Italian vacation! We loved our corner room overlooking the Piazza and my son loved being near the fun crowds at Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. We walked everywhere from this great location , except to the Vatican. We'll plan to stay at the Cesari again on our next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: KELor
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, staff were friendly, and location was excellent. We had a problem in that our room was noisy even with shutters and windows closed. There was an alley below our window with many, many motorcycles parked there. Also, our mattresses were as hard as rocks. Asked to change rooms but no others were available. Instead we decided to change hotels, so we could get some sleep. I would consider staying here in the future, but would request a quiet room. It really is a charming hotel if we could have resolved the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: krog6
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! This hotel is about as central as you can get to all the various sites in Rome. Accomodations are nice. Room was very clean and the staff was very helpful. We found the room a little warmer than we would have liked, but that's Rome in the summer! We bought a little table fan and were fine for the trip. Overall, a very nice little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall hotel”
Reviews.Author: daisyLR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cesari for four nights the end of June. As the other reviewers have said, the location of the hotel was perfect, so close to so many things. We walked nearly everywhere! The staff at the hotel was very helpful and they helped me find a particular soccer jersey for my son. The only drawback was that it was VERY hot in Rome during our stay and the A/C, although it did seem to be working, had a hard time keeping the room cool, even with the shutters closed to the sun all day. However, this would NOT keep me from going back to this hotel the next time we are in Rome. Free internet access was a major plus. Our room was huge by European standards and the bathroom was very nice. Noise was not really a problem, as our room faced the side street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe and great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Albergo Cesari for 4 nights in late May '05. The hotel was conveniently located (5 minutes to Trevi Fountain, 15 minutes to the Colleseum/Roman Forum) and very clean. Breakfast and service were both ok - nothing special, but no complaints. Would definately stay there again based on the price and excellent location. Also, highly recommend Stefano Constaniti as a driver to set up for the trip from the airport (see the Rome forum discussions on trip advisor for his contact info). Very nice guy with affordable service (42 euro).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: flowermoon
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a brilliant location. Stayed here with a friend for 3 nights at the start of June, and it couldn't have been better. Rooms are spacious and clean, and very comfortable. The breakfast room is small as other reviews have stated, but there is a lot of variation in the food provided and we never found it to be busy (eating at about 8am). The location of the hotel is brilliant - it is within walking distance of lots of major attractions, minutes away from both the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain. A really lovely area to stay in. Would highly suggest staying in this hotel and definitely plan to stay there if I'm ever in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: willful
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cesari for four nights and were totally satisfied. The reviews in Tripadvisor were accurate. The location is very central while noise is OK. There is talk and laughter from the plaza until 2AM, which one can view as romantic or annoying, but the triple glazed windows shut out noise completely. We chose the fresh air. The breakfast selection is varied and of good quality, but you cannot linger as other guests are waiting for one of the limited tables. The daytime staff was helpful and knowledgeable. We took advantage of their pick-up service at the airport. The driver was very friendly, spoke excellent English, and gave a short guided tour of sights as we entered the city. Since the street in front of Cesari is pedestrian, it is very tricky to get there. Someone not very familiar with Rome should not even think about driving to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: twitcherjune
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from our Italian trip. We spent our first 3 nights at the Cesari and had a wonderful time. For Rome this was a relatively quiet hotel with less street noise than some places. It is an excellent location - we could walk to all the major sites. The reception staff were always helpful. Indeed, when my husband needed to see a doctor they telephoned for us and the doctor was there within the hour. We had an excellent breakfast each morning. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DavideB
Reviews.Content: I have just been at the Hotel Cesari with my wife for the weekend and we really enjoyed it. It's located in the historic center of Rome, in a quiet road where traffic is not permitted. It is at walking distance from many tourist sites, like Pantheon, Trevi fountain... The rooms are of good size and with nice furnitures. The breakfast is excellent, offering cakes and sweets of outstanding quality. It is a small and quiet hotel at the best location available for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LarrywashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the hotel. We stayed here in november 2004. It is not five star, but it is a very good value for the money. The location is great. We walked to all the sites. The rooms were good sized and very clean. The staff were extremely helpful. I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Roman”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
