Reviews.Content: Cute, small hotel in the middle of Rome. Blocks to the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, & Trevi Fountain. The room windows overlook a small walkway w/ music and restaurants. The bedroom features were more than adequate. It is not too loud at night, but rather the music adds a romantic element to the stay. At this price, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome where we spent three nights at the Cesari. The location couldn't be beat -5 min from Pantheon and Trevi, 15 min from P. Navona and a little more to Campo de Fiori. We walked everywhere and if we needed to, it was usually convenient to stop by the hotel. The street was a little noisy at night, preventing us from leaving our shutters open while we slept. When the windows and shutters were closed, the outdoor noise could barely be heard. The hotel was clean and charming, and we found the staff to be indifferent at worst, but mostly helpful and pleasant. The free online access was great and although the breakfast room was tight, the breakfast was nice and the freshly made cappuchino was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, will definatley return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from our first short stay in Rome. The Cesari was a great choice for us with plenty of help from the staff. Very clean and in a great location. Will certainly return

Reviews.Title: “Not Thrilled”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The public spaces are a bit worn, and the breakfast room is way too tiny for the overflowing crowd that this hotel seems to be attracting. Our room was adequate, especially on the second night when we found the a/c button. The bathroom was good. The hotel is in the center of town, on a very noisy and narrow street. The front desk fellow was the rudest we have encountered on several trips to Italy. I think he was ready for the season and the crowds to end. Next time in Rome we are going back to Albergo Santa Chiara!

Reviews.Title: “Central AND peaceful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and mother have just got back from a break in Rome at the Cesari. The location was fabulous - a few minutes walk to the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain, and we even walked to the Colosseum, Forum and Vatican (although they were a bit further). It is next to the Via Corso and quite near Piazza Venezia, where you can get buses if walking isn't your thing. The hotel is in a pedestrianised street, with plenty of restaurants and pizzerias on the doorstep - but the double glazing andshutters mean you hardly hear a sound. Air conditioned, clean, spacious room, nice big bathroom, comfortable beds, plus lovely breakfast with plenty of variety, pleasant staff. We would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in August of 2004. We read the reviews on tripadvisor and were delighted to find they were all true. The hotel was in an excellent location, within walking distance of major attractions. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Our room was clean, spacious and decorated nicely. The rates were reasonable. Overall very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: mrstravel
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and my 2 kids stayed here for 3 nights from August 21 st to the 24 th. The quad room was wonderful. It was very spacious. It had a king size bed and 2 singles. The a/c worked great. The shutters on the window were great. we didn't hear any noise at all, and they didn't let any light in. The front desk staff was wonderful and always tried to help. There was free internet service in the lobby. The breakfast was perfectly fine. The location can't be beat. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Cesari”
Reviews.Author: hotellooker
Reviews.Content: Breakfast poor. -cheaper meat, fresh fruit unripe and canned fruit seemed spritzy, coffee odd. Staff at desk nice and will answer questions. Rooms large and the double windows for sound really work.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: ed78
Reviews.Content: Spent hours reviewing hotels. I'm so glad we chose this one. The location is perfect. It's on a lively street: 2 blocks right is the Trevi fountain, 2 blocks left is the Pantheon. There are street vendors and outdoor cafes within steps of the hotel. But they'll never disturb your sleep. The rooms are air-conditioned, large, quiet, elegant and CLEAN! The staff is friendly and knowledgeable (not what we found at other hotels on our trip). We stayed at a 4 1/2 star hotel on this trip that couldn't compete with the Cesari on hospitality, comfort, cleanliness or location. When we return, we won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Cesari”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After hours and hours of wading through reviews I decided upon The Cesari and was SO happy with my selection. The location is ideal and I cannot describe how amazing it was to wind through the narrow streets a short distance and end up at the Pantheon. The room was a good size and the beds were extremely comfortable. We were there the beginning of August and the air conditioning made our room an oasis! The staff was very accommodating and were so kind to satisfy this American's craving for ice. Each time it was requested a larger bucket arrived! The breakfast was pleasant with delicious fruit and fresh cappacino made by a delightful staff member. We found the desk persons to be kind and helpful. Cabs arrived within a moment of the call! Look no further, Hotel Cesari will make a trip to this fabulous city extra memorable and the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rome !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first thing to say about the Cesari is do not judge a book by it's cover, from the outside the hotel does not look great at all (apart from the doorway) But inside it is lovely, small, cosy, clean and welcoming. The staff are just the same too. We had our youngest with us who is just under 2 and the staff were very friendly to him, one man even kept giving him a sweet everytime he saw him. The room was lovely too, perfect size (we had a triple superior room) with a big double bed and they put a good quality travel cot in there for baby. Large bathroom, lots of towels. The windows in the room really kept the noise out from the street below. The rooms were kept perfectly clean and beds (including baby's) were made everyday The location of the Cesari as people have mentioned really is fantastic, we walked to every sight apart from the Vatican City which we got a taxi to. The Trevi Fountain which was one of my favourate places in Rome was less tan 5 minutes walk, as was the Pantheon. Most evenings we went to the Piaza Navona where there is a grreat restaurant called Dolce Vita which I highly reccomend. It's also a great place to shop (Navona not restaurant) All the artists are there daily selling some beautiful water colours, you can also buy various gifts from the sellers there. Rome is an expensive city in general but as long as you know that you won't be too shocked. One word of warning though, beware the roads, the drivers do not seem to know what zebra crossings are for or indicators and crossing the road can be scary as they also drive fast. We were even nearly knocked down by a couple of nuns in a car flying across a zebra crossing at the Vatican while we were trying to cross with our little boy in his buggy. I would reccomend this hotel if you don't mind small hotels without discos etc, it has a bar but it's very small and shuts at 10pm. The rooms do have tv but the only English speaking channel is American News channel CNN. Have a great time if you do go to Rome or the Cesari (we were in room 43 on 4th floor, there is a lift and we never noticed any bad smell someone else mentioned)

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there twice in the same trip. Would go again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice in the same trip. Each time in two rooms with our three kids. The air-con is good. The room is well appointed and everything works. The staff are pleasant and one of the women in the breakfast room is a delight. It is an oasis in central Rome. When the heat of summer gets to you, just go back home in a few seconds and have a rest. Internet is free and when they say they are ordering a taxi it arrives [unlike some other experiences we had]. It's a fantastic spot for a Roman affair! Don't waste time on other places.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location and Very Spacious”
Reviews.Author: McDocEdmontonCanada
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here for five nights in late July, 2004. Our room for four was very spacious, clean, and quiet. Despite hot weather, the air conditioning was effective. Staff were friendly and helpful, and breakfast was good. The location is superb; we were able to walk everywhere and never felt unsafe.
